3839.overview_html: Are you proficient in Java, C#, PHP or Python? Are you experienced in AWS services? We’re looking for a skilled influencer and self-starter who’s familiar with Agile methodologies to join our team as a DevOps Engineer, where you’ll collaborate with agile and Cloud Ops teams to help design, build and augment our software delivery pipeline. As a DevOps Engineer, you’ll make recommendations as to how we can improve the software delivery process, and create cloud infrastructure and configuration as code to automate provisioning and scaling processes. You’ll document products and processes and establish standards for deployment automation, and perform code reviews to ensure adherence. If you’re a proactive problem-solver with superb communication skills, let’s talk!
3839.responsibilities_html:
• Consult, collaborate and implement solutions in concert architecture team
  • Gathers requirements from development staff, formulates plans, and deploys solutions
  • Supports all servers in development, including installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, etc.
  • Infrastructure support and administration for all Development team tools (Atlassian suite, Jenkins etc.)
  • Provide support for development with tools, automation and self service.
  • Develops new solutions to replace static assets with cloud infrastructure automation.
  • Monitors, logs, resolves, and escalate issues with development, test, and supporting applications. Ensure all services are available and secure
  • Administers virtual networks and cloud assets, tests for secure networking
  • Administers security, patching, and develops automation scripting utilizing various scripting languages and technologies
  • Develops operations procedures to ensure timely resolution or escalation of issues
  • Mentor Levels I and II
  • Provides regular status reports and gather requirements from departments and internal customers and provides input into the infrastructure products that are bought or built
  • Documents and maintains operational procedures, develop and oversee project plans, and implements change control procedures. Participate in technical advisory roles, as required
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies
3839.qualifications_html:
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in computer systems or operation/production environment
  • Experience with cloud service vendors (AWS, Azure etc.)
  • Skilled in one or more of the following scripting languages/frameworks (Bash, Python, Perl, JS, Ruby, Java)
  • Experience with an Automation framework (Chef, Puppet Ansible, CloudFormation)
  • Experience with container technologies
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision 
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to plan and schedule activities and functions 
  • Good interpersonal skills across all levels of the organization
  • Ability to handle multiple projects/assignments/tasks simultaneously and achieve results
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative, who can proactively identify issues/opportunities and recommend and/or take actions
  • Strong results orientation
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation
  • BA/BS preferred or relevant work experience

3857.overview_html: Calling all sales superstars! Have you sold Software as a Service (SaaS) to large, global brands? We’re seeking an expert communicator and experienced sales professional to join our team as an Account Executive (Enterprise), where you’ll help us achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration in the UK. In this role, you’ll proactively establish, develop and maintain effective business relationships with prospective customers to generate new business for our product suite, as well as identify cross-sell and up-sell potential. As an Account Executive, you’ll also be expected to prospect within your existing network and devise creative strategies for penetration. This is a terrific opportunity for someone with a start-up mindset who wants to help us expand our footprint while being supported by a significant global infrastructure. If you’re persistent, resourceful, and have experience closing complex, high-stakes deals, let’s chat!
3857.responsibilities_html:
• Targets companies within segment that prioritize winning the war for talent and attracting the best people to their organization.
  • Drives new business and customer growth within assigned segment.
  • Executes on growth and retention processes, accurately provides account forecasts.
  • Establishes a plan to identify accounts business challenges and needs, both short and long-term goals, while evaluating opportunities and targeting those with the greatest potential for producing positive results.
  • Identifies risks and opportunities within accounts and proactively addresses both in a timely manner
  • Builds and maintains relationships with customers at all levels, including senior leadership and C-suite, to assess needs and effectively link product value, features/benefits to those needs. Works internally to align appropriate team sell-approach.
  • Serves as a trusted advisor, credible and influential throughout the process, driving business to best meet customers’ evolving needs with multiple layers of organizations, including Senior Leadership.
  • Leverages the vast infrastructure of support and information which iCIMS as an organization offers
  • Follows well defined sales methodology to ensure prospects are a good fit for iCIMS’ long term.
  • Understands big picture of iCIMS’ product suite and how it can fit into client organization. Closes deals while setting stage for additional product sales within organization.
  • Influences colleagues internally to help resolve problems and escalate issues as necessary.
  • Asks meaningful questions in order to fully understand the landscape they are working in as well as other people’s landscape
  • Presents and positions iCIMS’ products/services to prospective customers via on site visits.
  • Shows creativity and has the intelligence to present unique ideas.
  • Represents the iCIMS organization with professionalism and integrity.
  • Partners with iCIMS’ Sales Engineers and other subject matter experts to demonstrate product and service capabilities.
  • Builds sales funnels through prospecting efforts including but not limited to client referrals, regional networking, webinars and cold calling.
  • Follows-up and actions on new leads and referrals resulting from marketing and prospecting activity.
  • Develops and maintains detailed product and marketplace understanding to help prospective customers make well informed buying decisions.
  • Plans and organizes personal sales strategy by thoroughly understanding the business cycles and timing for all accounts.
  • Prepares presentations, demonstrations, investment summaries, and sales contracts.
  • Is disciplined when gathering and recording information accurately, giving visibility to the rest of the business
  • Closes deals of significant size, complexity and sales cycle length.
  • Effectively builds and maintains partnerships with clients, prospects and people at all levels across the company. Contributes to team and company success.
  • Consistently targets and closes deals of significant complexity while setting stage for additional product sales within organization.
  • Effectively interfaces with multiple departments within client organization including C – Suite.
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ core competencies.

 

Additional Job Responsibilities:

  • Can thrive in a start-up environment within a larger organisation
  • Uses Salesforce CRM to track and record sales activity to ensure that metrics can be accurately measured.
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and takes initiative when appropriate.
  • Incorporates 360 degree selling methodology and techniques to close large, complex deals by sales efforts with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Maintains flexibility and reacts to change appropriately.
  • Receives and takes action on feedback for continual professional improvement and development.
  • Takes measures to enhance body of knowledge and skill set through training.
  • Communicates and shares information with candor that builds trust and enhances relationships.
  • Other duties as assigned.
3857.qualifications_html:
• Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
  • Minimum of 8 years B2B sales experience selling HR/HCM, Software or Software-as-a-Service directly into Enterprise accounts into the C suite.
  • Superior knowledge of the practices and principles related to sales cycles / sales techniques.
  • Skilled at closing deals that are more advanced in scope and size. Customers consistently have significant elements of complexity (i.e. decentralized or with multiple business units / brands, global presence).
  • Effective at developing and maintaining client relationships at senior management (C– Suite) levels.
  • Consistently applies strategic approach to deal crafting and relationship building.
  • Proven track record in soliciting and closing B2B sales against a quota.
  • Demonstrated effectiveness in new business development strategies and lead qualification.
  • Effective time-management skills, ability to multi-task and handle multiple accounts and issues simultaneously.
  • Proven ability to leverage established relationships and proven sales techniques for success.
  • Ability to clearly present and effectively overcome objections.
  • Demonstrated aptitude for problem-solving.
  • Able to work both independently and within a team environment.
  • Computer literate; proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Salesforce).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively with appropriate empathy.
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth.
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative.
  • Understands how to approach sales from a strategic perspective.
  • Strong Results Orientation with a focus on closing long term sales cycles.
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation. Creates and sustains ongoing forums that encourage two-way communication opportunities.
  • Ability to travel at 30 – 40%.

 

Education/Certifications/Licenses Required:

  • BA/BS preferred or relevant work experience
  • Organizational Core Competencies
  • Adaptability - A capacity to embrace change with a positive, team-oriented attitude toward results.
  • Customer Commitment - The ability to deliver a “customer” experience second to none, balances what’s right for one’s customers with the productive use of resources.
  • Drive - Confidence, backed by an internal will to take ownership and initiative to overcome obstacles and deliver results.
  • Empathy - Ability to put yourself in someone’s position and understand their concerns and motivations.
  • Kaizen - An aptitude for continuous improvement, presenting new ideas and executing upon them to achieve results and improve processes and systems.
  • Passion - An unrelenting enthusiasm linked to belief in our vision, mission and/or philosophies of the company.
  • Transparency - Tell it how it is, through honest communication, building trust and fostering alignment, while respecting confidences & privacy
  • Work Schedule / Hours:  standard 9:00 am – 6:00 pm
  • Travel: 30 - 40%

We’re looking for an adept influencer with a solid design understanding and strong Java skills to join our team as a Software Engineer III, where you’ll focus on developing scalable web and responsive applications for our growing customer base. As a Software Engineer III, you’ll work on both new initiatives and our existing product suite, and will be assigned a set of tasks for a given sprint. 4107.overview_html: Are you a Java genius with strong data background? Is your expertise full-stack product development? We’re looking for a results-oriented expert communicator with secured data and secured transaction experience to join our team as a Principal Software Architect (Enterprise PaaS), where you’ll be responsible for the end-to-end architecture, design and development of our Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) product offering. In this role, you’ll research and evaluate new technologies, languages and design patterns, applying your expertise to strategic and product architecture decisions and working to advance the overall product architecture. We’re looking for someone who’s taken projects from concepts to implementation—someone who can successfully articulate a vision, and who can build prototypes in a well-documented way. If you’re a skilled multitasker who wants to work on high visibility projects with big commercial impact, this could be your next big thing!
4107.responsibilities_html:
· Lead end-to-end product and feature architecture and design with highest degree of software quality in mind

· Apply expertise to strategic & product architecture decisions

· Participate or speak at external events as an iCIMS representative

· Research and evaluate new technologies, languages and design patterns

· Advance the overall platform architecture, including selecting new technologies

· Design and develop production solutions, prototypes, or reference implementations for either complex and/or products or features

· Collaborate with Product Management and agile teams to design and build innovative and market leading features built with high quality and utilizing software best practices

· Lead development and software performance best practices for agile team members Requirements/Skills/Abilities

· Perform design reviews for new feature development from agile teams

· Consistently ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies

· Mentor Software Developers (III-IV)

· Advanced knowledge of Object Oriented Design, Microservices, Service Oriented Architecture and Application Integration Design Patterns

· Advanced expertise in Java (including Java 8 with knowledge of Java 9)

· Expertise in multiple technologies and domains

· Expertise in JSON, RESTful services, and similar related technologies

· Advanced proficiency in several of the following: REACT, Javascript, Spring, Hibernate, HTML, CSS, JSP, AJAX, Swift, Android Development

· Agile, or Iterative software development and delivery experience required

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively. Create and deliver presentations articulating vision, findings, and approach to all stakeholders

· Creates external value through patents, white papers, or speaking at conferences

· Creates brand and company equity

· Ideal candidate is results oriented, innovative, self-motivated, possesses excellent interpersonal and communication skills

· Ability to multi-task successfully and manage multiple responsibilities

· Willingness to learn, while also offering own insight, suggestions and feedback

· Experience with AWS, SaaS applications, and other modern cloud-based tools is a plus

 

Education/Certifications/Licenses Required

4108.overview_html: Do you have experience with product roadmap planning? Are you a skilled relationship builder? We’re looking for a business savvy, expert multitasker to join our team as a Product Manager, where you’ll act as the “voice of the customer” for all stages and types of Technology Department initiatives. As a Product Manager, you’ll serve as an internal advocate for the Talent Acquisition market and internal stakeholders as it relates to market problems, opportunities and portfolio initiatives, researching and analyzing data, defining requirements, and prioritizing features and enhancements. If you’re a creative problem-solver with strong business acumen, let’s talk!
4108.responsibilities_html:
• Manages, develops, and implements product activities to maximize sales of an assigned product
  • Acts as an advocate for the customer, internal stakeholders and business partners as it relates to product issues and improvements
  • Analyzes brand performance, brand competitiveness, and product trends in the marketplace and develops product strategies based on research and analysis
  • Liaises with Product Marketing to ensure product positioning is effectively communicated
  • Liaises with Business Analysts and Labs teams to clearly communicates business objectives and requirements for the assigned product requirements
  • Works cross-functionally across the organization to identify opportunities for process improvement associated with product implementation and support
  • Directly supports high profile customer events (CAC, HEI, etc..) and customer engagement programs (PEP)
  • A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies
4108.qualifications_html:
• 5+ years of product management experience
  • Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously
  • The desire to be part of and to contribute to a team environment
  • Ability to works under limited manager supervision- exceptionally self-motivated and creative.
  • Strategic analysis, creative problem solving, business judgment and financial acumen are required.
  • Expert knowledge and planning of multiple products. General knowledge of product lifecycle management.
  • Technical ability to manage project assignments with a wide range of complexity in various areas of knowledge.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to convey thoughts and ideas across all levels of the organization
  • Exceptional relationship building skills and the ability to strategically plan and influence across all departments in the organization.

4118.overview_html: Are you skilled in Java, Python, Javascript or HTML? Do you have proficiency in design patterns, automation and agile methodology? We’re seeking a proactive self-starter with a strong results orientation to join our team as a Software Engineer II (SEII), where you’ll develop scalable web and responsible applications that touch our growing customer base. As part of iCIMS Labs—our world-class engineering program focused on the research, design, development, deployment and testing of our product suite—you’ll collaborate with agile team members to enhance existing system functionality, implement new features, and research and remedy issues as they arise. If you’re an effective communicator looking to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, high growth environment, let’s talk!
4118.responsibilities_html:
• Expertise and proficiency in multiple technologies and/or domain
  • Develop, test and maintain a scalable web and responsive applications
  • Design and develop scalable and reliable automated test frameworks
  • Collaborate with agile team members on achieving Sprint deliverables
  • Implement new features and perform code reviews
  • Research and resolve complex problems as they arise
  • Using engineering best practices, design, develop, analyze test plans and strategies to meet performance, usability, scalability, reliability and security needs
  • Mentor Software Engineers (I)
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ policies, procedures, and core competencies.

  • Advanced proficiency in one or more of the following back-end or front-end: Java, Python, JavaScript, iOS development (Swift, Objective C), Android development
  • Proficiency in one or more of the following frameworks or libraries, such as: Hibernate and Spring, Reactjs and Redux, node.js

  • Firm understanding of software engineering practices, philosophies and techniques
  • Experience folllowing Agile/SCRUM techniques
  • Ability to influence, lead and organize an agile team with a focus on results
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative, who can proactively identify issues/opportunities, recommend and implement solutions

  • Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or other technical degree and 1 years of software engineering experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or other technical degree and 2 years of experience developing recruiting software or 3 years of software engineering experience.

4121.overview_html: Are you passionate about test strategy? Do you want to influence the test architecture, tools and techniques in an evolving technology ecosystem? If so, then you may be the person who we need to fill our opening for an innovative, self-motivated Test Architect in our Labs Department! You will design, develop and deliver our test strategy that will allow us to gauge the function, automation, performance and security of our products. If you have the ability to work with teams to implement the strategy and provide governance over it, then apply!

  • Recommend, lead and continuously improve the architecture and technical direction of functional and performance tests
  • Partner with software development engineers and test engineers to devise automation and test strategies including test cases development to drive the software development process towards quality-centric methodologies.
  • Interact with development engineers to devise automation strategies, test strategies and test cases to automate new features and enhance existing functionality
  • Collaborate with DevOps team to ensure test framework and methodologies are integrated with the continuous integration
  • Own the overall technical roadmap of automation in collaboration with development and QA teams
  • Perform code reviews for software development engineers and software development engineers in test 
  • Mentor and guide Software Development Engineer in Test of all levels
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all time, that processes and procedures are followed and that behavior aligns with iCIMS core competencies

• Minimum 8 years of software engineering experience, demonstrating experience in scalable software design and development with a proven track record of technical achievements
  • Additional 3+ years of Professional SDET or QA Engineer experience developing automated frameworks and running automated tests 
  • Experience developing test frameworks for mobile is a plus
  • Advanced knowledge of Object Oriented Design, Service Oriented Architecture and Design Patterns
  • Advanced use of effective application development with Java, Spring, Hibernate and SQL
  • Strong proficiency in web-based technologies including AJAX, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XML, JSON, RESTful services and similar related technologies
  • Strong knowledge of testing and automating REST and RESTful based web services
  • Agile, Lean, Iterative software development and delivery experience required
  • Experience with Continuous Integration / Continuous deployment
  • Experience developing automation frameworks such as Selenium Web driver
  • Innovative, self-motivated, possessing excellent interpersonal, communication and leadership skills
  • Results driven, thrives in a development environment that is agile, collaborative, fast paced and one that is going through high growth, even when faced with ambiguity
  • Ability to teach and train SDET I, II, III, and IV levels
  • BA/BS or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or other technical degree from a reputable institution. Masters preferred.
  • In lieu of bachelor’s or technical degree, we will accept 4 additional years of software engineering experience

4125.overview_html: Passionate about building great front-end experiences? Are you proficient in interactive technologies? We’re looking for a web dev whiz with a solid understanding of object-oriented design to join our team as a UI Web Developer, where you’ll develop elegant and engaging user interfaces for internal and external properties using Javascript, Angular, React JS, HTML and CSS. In this role, you’ll collaborate with project stakeholders, marketing, cloud/information services, and product design teams to build high-quality web sites, web applications and digital marketing tools that align with the business needs and our technical infrastructure. If you’re a transparent, hands-on team player who wants to create new UI components and help us move away from legacy front-end code, this job is right up your alley!

4207.overview_html: Have you negotiated a high volume of complex contracts? Are you used to working with client-facing teams? We’re looking for a creative problem-solver who’s cool under pressure to join our team as a Counsel - Contracting, Technology, where you’ll provide commercial contracting support and legal counsel for various business teams throughout the organization. In this role, you’ll be working with name brand, global vendors, partners and customers to help us negotiate complex, SaaS agreements and other contracts. You’ll negotiate issues relating to data privacy and security matters, provide legal and contract support for our extensive vendor marketplace, and help us negotiate strategic partnerships. To succeed, you’ll need to be able to expertly identify nuanced legal issues with an eye to our business needs, and devise ways for the business to forge ahead when faced with potential roadblocks. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a fast-growing, evolving technology company and help drive exciting new initiatives. If you’re an organized, self-starter who lives for closing a deal, let’s chat!
4207.responsibilities_html:
The role will focus on the following key areas:
• Negotiate global, complex vendor and customer contracts, including, subscription, software licensing and services arrangements, as well as, partner and alliance agreements.
• Partner to manage and negotiate vendor relationships and assist with building effective partnerships, while helping to lower costs and secure agreements.
• Act as an advisor to internal customers on a variety of legal matters.
• Help enable the business to execute on commercial changes by understanding and providing guidance on relevant legal and compliance issues.
• Aid in the adoption and execution of controls necessary to ensure compliance as an employer and third-party service provider, including drafting, reviewing, updating, and enforcing internal policies and procedures.
• As necessary, drive intellectual property protection and enforcement, including copyrights, trade secrets, and patents, as applicable.

• Assist with litigation matters, as necessary.
• Conduct research on a variety of legal issues and act as an expert on some key areas.

• Consistently ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies

• Strong drafting skills.

• Ability to work independently, while being a collaborative member of the team
• Ability to analyze case law and provide recommendations.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
• Strong customer orientation focus and success in creating a superior Customer Experience.
• Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with the Management and Executive Team, and company employees.
• Demonstrated success in displaying passion, drive, adaptability and innovation.
• Ability to organize and manage multiple, and at times competing priorities.
• Demonstrated ability to solve practical problems or resolve issues in a timely manner.
• Proficient in the MS Office Suite
• Ability to thrive in a fast paced, growing organization.
• Strong track record of success in building solid working relationships within various areas/business functions of the company.

Education/Certifications/Licenses Required

• Membership in the State Bar as an attorney qualified to practice law in the State of NJ, or eligible to become licensed as in-house counsel.

4501.overview_html: Are you an analytical privacy professional with experience conducting privacy impact assessments? We’re looking for an expert relationship builder with top-notch communication skills to join our team as a Privacy Analyst, where you’ll support the iCIMS Legal team through the preparation and review of privacy documents and provide general support to the growing function within the organization. In this role, you’ll work with the Corporate Privacy and Regulatory Counsel to execute on the privacy strategy and collaborate with local and international business partners to facilitate data protection and privacy compliance. You’ll also help manage privacy incident responses as well as coordinate responses to data subject access requests. We’re looking for someone who can bring fresh ideas to the table—someone who wants to drive process improvements and further efficiency within the department. If you’re a strong leader who understands technology, and enjoys partnering with different areas of the business to address privacy needs, this could be a perfect fit!
4501.responsibilities_html:
• Serve as first point of contact for Company employees in relation to escalations, data subject requests, privacy impact assessments, and related legal queries.
  • Support the effective execution of the iCIMS privacy program.
  • Coordinate review and input from appropriate sources as needed to complete privacy documents.
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of processes and procedures to help ensure compliance with iCIMS policies and privacy/data protection laws, regulations and guidelines.
  • Assist in implementing and facilitating appropriate GDPR compliance procedures and training.
  • Assist in developing a more mature state of privacy and GDPR readiness.
  • Act as a liaison with key internal departments to address and integrate privacy requirements
  • Work with functional partners to help develop and implement new systems related to Data Subject Rights tools within our privacy management software tool.
  • Support Legal counsel in implementing iCIMS global privacy projects, including, but not limited to, privacy impact assessment and data protection impact assessments.
  • Manage process for handling data subject rights requests.
  • Manage privacy incident response in collaboration with the Legal and Information Security departments.
  • Facilitate the continuous improvement of training policies and standard operating procedures for the protection of personal data.
  • Monitor and update internal functions on data protection and privacy legal regulatory requirements that may affect them.
  • Acquire and maintain knowledge of Company systems that include personal data, and stay informed about updates and modifications to these systems.
4501.qualifications_html:
• A minimum of 5 years of experience in privacy and technology project management/administration. Previous experience working for a software or technology company is preferred.
  • General knowledge and comfort discussing technology and networking protocols.
  • Ability to interact professionally with all levels of management, multiple geographies, internal subject matter experts, legal staff, vendors, and clients.
  • Ability to communicate and manage personal project timelines and responsibilities.
  • Ability to synthesize information from a variety of sources and present it in a meaningful and concise way.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative, who can proactively identify issues/opportunities and recommend actions.
  • Strong customer service orientation.
  • Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize in a constantly changing and fast paced environment
  • Outstanding follow-up, organization and planning skills.
  • Ability to work independently, often without detailed instructions.
  • Advanced MS Office Suite Skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team atmosphere.
  • Strong results orientation.
  • Strong track record of success in building solid working relationships within various areas/business functions of the company.

4524.overview_html: Are you a senior strategist who’s run marketing, positioning and/or corporate communications for a large, multinational business or research firm? Have you successfully leveraged thought leadership to impact brand? We’re looking for an innovative, driven critical thinker to join our team as a Sr. Director, Brand, where you’ll oversee a team within the Marketing Department that includes corporate brand investment management, recruitment marketing, public and analyst relations, thought leadership and proprietary research development, employee communications, in-house design and development and event planning (self-hosted, third-party and employee engagement). You’ll be responsible for the overall in-market representation of iCIMS, and will work closely with our Chief Marketing Officer and third-party agencies to set brand direction and oversee brand-oriented investments for the company including the positioning and consistency of the visual look and feel of our communications, public and analyst relations efforts, thought leadership resources and research, events and brand awareness research among key buyer personas. If you’re a top-notch communicator and seasoned leader with a proven track record of driving results, this could be a perfect match.
4524.responsibilities_html:
Strategy: 

  • Partner with Chief Marketing Officer to craft the strategy for the organization’s brand investment.
  • Collaborate with VP, Marketing to establish planning and prioritization for the brand team resources aligned to overall department goals. 
  • Collaborate with executives across the business to build buy-in and engagement around the established direction and objectives of brand.

Team Leadership: 

  • Provide leadership to ensure that set objectives are met while also ensuring that there is the requisite sponsorship, alignment and support of all stakeholders connected with the organization.
  • Build out the thought leadership practice with resources as defined by the company’s strategic plans.
  • Maintain a high-performance team and work environment enabling operational objectives and acquisition/retention of people resources to fulfill team mission.
  • Lead and mentor both direct and indirect reports with the goal of improving their professional expertise to better serve business initiatives. 
  • Work effectively and collaboratively as a team member with other members of management.
  • Be the internal champion for our corporate brand direction -- within the Marketing Department, with respect to how this work impacts other functional areas of the team – and across the company at large.
  • Lead external agency teams as though they were an extension of our internal resources – with transparency and collaboration – offering timely insights, clear direction, and appropriate future-state planning exercises.
  • Manage team members’ performance including formal reviews, establishing departmental and individual objectives and performing applicable assessments. 
  • Ensure appropriate resource allocation and organizational structure to produce expected results. 
  • Plan for and socialize future-state organizational structures with senior leadership.
  • Take measures to enhance body of knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
  • Ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies. 

Process: 

  • Operationalize and effectively execute on the brand strategy across all company outreach materials, including, but not limited to, the corporate website, customer care site, social media, select campaign materials, other demand generation marketing investments, presentation templates, sales collateral materials, even the iCIMS Talent Platform.
  • Devise, monitor, and action on the annual objectives and corresponding metrics of the various teams directed.
  • Cultivate and maintain influencer, business and trade media relationships across strategic imperatives for thought leadership in support of increasing iCIMS profile and visibility.
  • Respond to industry developments in a timely and comprehensive manner and contribute to the successful positioning of the organization.
  • Ensure that all iCIMS events (self-hosted, third-party, employee engagement) are brand consistent, impactful, and that the logistics are completed on time and on budget. Monitor the performance of events with respect to lead creation, where applicable.
  • Work with internal and external resources to manage the company’s discrete recruitment marketing investments and monitor the performance of those investments and programs versus annual business objectives.
  • Help refine and elevate the current design standards across all of iCIMS’ brand communication materials.
  • Identify, mentor, and consistently challenge key creative and development resources to improve the impact of our internally designed materials.
  • Monitor programs, procedures and metrics to ensure on-time delivery and overall customer satisfaction.
  • Establish and maintain relevant controls and feedback systems to monitor the operation of the department including reporting on performance metrics and results to the Executive Team. 
  • Understand industry best practices and processes, presenting recommendations as necessary for the company to remain compliant and competitive.
  • Ensure process documents are complete, current, communicated and stored appropriately. 

Metrics: 

  • Establish and maintain a budget staying within spending parameters.
  • Measure departmental performance by implementing and refining metrics and reporting to stakeholders as appropriate.
  • Benchmark and monitor brand awareness year-over-year among key buyer personas.
4524.qualifications_html:
• Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising or closely related discipline.
  • Minimum 8 years directing brand marketing, communications and promotions, using a broad marketing mix of integrated approaches (advertising, public relations, events, promotions, digital, e-commerce, etc.).
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience in a Director level position or above.
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience leading and directing a growing team; ideally with experience “managing managers”.
  • Previous experience with managing events and calculating engagement ROI.
  • Innovative, creative, and visionary thinker, as demonstrated by leadership capabilities and accomplishments.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage outsourced marketing activities, including work performed by agencies/consultants to create best-in-class brand extension materials within all formats.
  • Experience with managing department accountability to top line growth as measured by a quantitative data including metrics such as leads, branding audits, website traffic.
  • Experience with the agency identification process and direct management of the selected agencies.
  • Strong listening skills coupled with an articulate and succinct communication style; have an ability to explain complex ideas effectively to a wide range of audiences.

  • Proficiency in one or more of the following is required: Java, Python, iOS development (Swift, Objective C), Android development

4552.overview_html: Is your background in computer science and engineering? Are you looking to jump-start a burgeoning career in technology? We’re seeking driven, passionate problem-solvers to join our team as a DevOps Engineer I, where you’ll help build and deploy server environments, primarily in virtual environments such as Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you’ll be responsible for support and issue resolution of deployment and test servers, as well as development tools and applications. If you want to push the limits of large-scale systems, identify bottlenecks and help implement adjustments to achieve optimal performance, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

• Administers security, patching, and develops basic automation scripting.
• Develops operations procedures to ensure timely resolution or escalation of issues.

• Documents and maintains operational procedures, develop and oversee project plans, and implements change control procedures. Participate in technical advisory roles, as required.
• Manages JIRA ticket resolution as assigned by senior staff members
• Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies

4556.overview_html:
Have development experience within a testing environment? Proficient in mentoring developers on secure coding? Skilled in Burp Suite Pro? We’re looking for an expert collaborator with an Agile background to join our team as a Security Test Engineer III, where you’ll be responsible for application development, coaching and mentoring colleagues on security tools, and preparing and executing security test cases for projects and features driven by the Product Management Council.

 

In addition to performing application security engineering, you’ll be responsible for manual and automated penetration testing of features scheduled for release, and will serve as a subject matter expert on our Secure Software Development Lifecycle. If you’re a top-notch communicator who wants to work on pilot programs, gain exposure to different technologies and mentor others within our organization, let’s chat!
4556.responsibilities_html:
• Responsible for Manual Functional, Security, and Regression testing of features scheduled for release
• Creates and maintains the Test Case Library, which can be run before every release by level II test engineers.
• Helps set up test data or test environment for running test cases.
• Reviews and verifies bug tickets within internal Bug Tracking Tool.
• Creates and tracks defects in the bug tracking tool effectively.
• Troubleshoots and helps address Security production tickets when routed to QA
• Monitors project/feature implementation with an eye toward improving security.
• Performs penetration and vulnerability assessments against projects/features, as necessary, and follow up to ensure that findings are properly addressed.
• Manages the iCIMS third party Security Testing for monitoring, creation and validation of security bugs.
• Prepares documentation for enabling “Test Labs” for agile teams
• Supports training and mentoring level I test engineers with iCIMS products and features as needed.
• Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies
4556.qualifications_html:
• Minimum of 4 years of software testing experience of web based products. Must be familiar with entire Software Development Life Cycle process
• 2+ years of specialized security testing, techniques and tools
• Must be familiar with static and dynamic code analysis methodologies and processes
• Exposed to various automated tools for Security.
• Familiarity in testing software written in various programming languages and technologies, including Java, SQL, HTML, JavaScript, and XML/XSL
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills
• Strong communication & interpersonal skills
• Self-motivated, able to learn and research issues independently
• Proficient in a Windows and MS-SQL environment
• Ability to apply risk based methodologies to information security issues
• Experience with vulnerability management tools similar to or such as Nessus, Rapid7, Qualys, Burpsuite, Saint, etc.
• Ability to leverage frameworks and standards such as SANS, NIST, ISO, and OWASP.

4559.overview_html: Are you a seasoned people manager with a proven track record of success driving customer retention, growth and product adoption? Do you have a background in scale/operation infrastructure? Strategy

  • Partner with Senior Director to build CS strategy in collaboration with Sales, Labs Leadership, Professional Services, Technical Support Services, and cross-departmental colleagues

Team Leadership

  • Measure team member performance and structure appropriate training and development
  • Lead and coach direct reports to achieve high performance and high engagement.
  • Contribute to company’s focus on segmentation through participation in internal cross-departmental initiatives
  • Ensure team metric targets are met
  • Serve as Steering Committee member on strategic projects
  • Ensure a fun, dynamic work environment & build merit-based culture which appeals to the top talent in the field
  • Partner with Talent team on the acquisition and retention of people resources to fulfill team mission successfully. Own the selection process.
  • Effectively communicate strategy inter-departmentally ensuring alignment, collaboration, and buy-in
  • Work cross-functionally to advocate for the customer experience within Majors
  • Build cross-departmental relationships with other leaders to maximize alignment on efforts, actions and results.
  • Provide reports on performance metrics and results with accountability to the Executive Team
  • Consistently ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies

Process

  • Oversee and take accountability for financial metrics including bookings, revenue & margin targets.
  • Plan, evaluate, and improve the efficiency of business processes and procedures to enhance speed, quality, efficiency, and output.
  • Manage the quality, consistency, accuracy, completeness, and testing of related processes and documentation.
  • Monitor programs, procedures and metrics to ensure on-time delivery and overall customer satisfaction
  • Ensure process documents are complete, current, communicated and stored appropriately
  • Establish and maintain relevant controls and feedback systems to monitor the operation of the department including reporting on performance metrics and results to the Executive Team
  • Understand industry best practices and apply to and processes, presenting recommendations as necessary for the company to remain compliant and competitive
  • Build cross-departmental relationships with other leaders to maximize alignment on efforts, actions and results
  • Lead the Technical Account Management team by providing vision, planning & prioritization for team resources delegating and assigning projects, duties, and objectives
  • Provide feedback and propose solutions regarding service failures or customer concerns
  • Ensure timely and appropriate training programs are administered to client organizations to enhance their customer experience and knowledge of the software

4581.overview_html: Have you served as an information architect and have a background in product design? We’re looking for a collaborative, creative problem-solver to join our Product Design team as an User Experience (UX) Architect II, where you’ll be responsible for initiating early concept work that influences our product roadmap and ensures a best-in-class customer experience. In this role, you’ll create wireframes, workflows, prototypes and other artifacts to communicate and document designs. If you’re innovative, persuasive and have a background in human computer interaction, information architecture, and usability, this could be the perfect job for you!   • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies

•  2 + years of overall software/UX architect experience, preferably in business-facing Saas Applications

  •  Visual and User-centered Design experience is a plus
  •  Experience in Prototyping is a plus
  •  Responsive design experience is a plus

  •  Innovative - self-motivated, able to research new concepts independently
  •  Persuasive – able to convince stakeholders of UX value and find win-win solutions
  •  Experience with designing and developing Responsive / Mobile solutions is a plus

  • Agile, Lean, Kanban, Iterative software development and delivery experience preferred

4620.overview_html: Calling all recruiting rock stars! Do you excel at building candidate pipelines across multiple disciplines at the leadership level? Can you expertly forge strong partnerships with the business? We’re looking for a detail-oriented, five-star communicator with strong sourcing skills to join our team as a Management Recruiter, where you’ll help us source and land top management talent. In this role, you’ll be responsible for conducting full-cycle recruiting for all manager level and above requisitions, in addition to sourcing and engaging passive candidates at the leadership level that are aligned to our future business needs. This is a unique opportunity for a consultative, skilled recruiter to join a fast-growing technology company that builds best in-class applicant tracking software—software that you’ll be able to use in your day-to-day. If you’re exceedingly driven, passionate and are just as obsessed with providing a best-in-class candidate experience as we are, we’re ready for you to come on board!
4620.responsibilities_html:
As a Management Recruiter you will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following essential duties and responsibilities:

  • Independently manage recruiting processes for all manager and above positions.
  • Partner with hiring managers on job postings and potential candidates, acting as a resource throughout the process, ensuring that candidates are thoughtfully considered and compared against job requirements, desired qualifications and cultural fit. 
  • Nurture and maintain relationships with identified passive talent to feed pipelines. 
  • Research competitive markets and peer organizations to develop and maintain external relationships with community based organizations to identify potential candidates through networking, cold calling, referrals and other proactive methods, reducing reliance on outside recruiting agencies 
  • Spend time with stakeholders to fully understand the business, the key talent needs, and the value proposition for prospective candidates. This includes maintaining relationships with hiring managers to stay abreast of current and future hiring needs. 
  • Maintain compliance with federal, state and local employment laws and ensure all hiring policies and procedures are adhered to 
  • In partnership with TA Manager, develops and adapts management/executive recruiting strategy to meet business needs 
  • Consults with stakeholders throughout the hiring process. Gives guidance on the interview, selection process and all aspects of the offer package.
4620.qualifications_html:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required 
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience conducting full cycle recruiting 
  • Minimum of 2 years of sourcing, candidate assessment and consulting with stakeholders on leadership/executive level searches in either a corporate or agency/executive search firm environment 
  • Excellent client relationship and influencing skills
  • Must be able to manage multiple requisitions simultaneously and have strong organizational skills as well as be able to prioritize in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong knowledge of complex recruiting, sourcing, and assessment of executive talent 
  • Deep knowledge of recruiting and/or executive search methodology and services 
  • Possess strong business acumen and able to act as a talent advisor /consultant to the business 
  • Strong negotiation and influencing skills
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures 
  • Communicates a "can do" attitude and positive outlook 
  • Professional image with ability to form good partner relationships across functions 
  • Demonstrates initiative and resourcefulness as well as an attention to detail 
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power-Point) 
  • PHR / SPHR, LinkedIn Recruiter and AIRS certified are all highly preferred.

5425.overview_html: The Security Engineer V will act as a key member of our Information Security team and handle diverse security-related tasks and issues for our rapidly growing company, including managing risk through a shared vision with the business leaders. While focusing on people, process, systems and metrics, and keeping up with the latest threats and trends in security, you will be tasked with having an enterprise wide understanding, as well as resolving, a variety of potential security issues across the iCIMS environment. As a Security Engineer V, you will also act as a senior lead in the investigation of events and incidents, including the identification of risks and recommendations for threat mitigation.  Activities will include security reviews and audits, vendor assessments, incident management, forensics, metrics tracking, exception tracking, sales and legal support, verification of adherence to security policy, and security engineering, including the design and implementation of security operations systems and processes.  You will be expected to engage in professional development to maintain continual growth in professional skills and knowledge essential to the position.
5425.responsibilities_html:
• Work closely with Director, Information Security in the identification, coordination, and facilitation of iCIMS security goals and initiatives.
  • Act as a senior representative for Information Security across the company, providing guidance and direction on matters pertaining to Information Security.
  • Leverage expert level knowledge of comprehensive security approaches against common and advanced attacks and exploits.
  • Participate and act as a key resource in addressing security incidents and events in order to protect customer and corporate data and critical systems.
  • Provide product, project, and ad hoc information security support and guidance while ensuring recommended solutions and processes adhere to iCIMS security standards and policies.
  • Participate in ISO 27001 certification and compliance audits and associated audit preparation.
  • Utilize a strong foundation in key technologies including servers, networking, operating systems, databases, SaaS, and cloud bases services to allow for effective evaluation and recommendations for designing secure systems and appropriate security controls and monitoring.
  • Evaluate and recommend security related technologies and solutions for future implementation.
  • Perform vendor and partner risk assessments to affirm compliance with iCIMS information security and regulatory requirements.
  • Handle sensitive and/or confidential material and information with suitable discretion.
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ policies, procedures, and core competencies.
  • Exercise excellent knowledge of security tools and technology including, but not limited to, tools related to Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), integrity monitoring, anti-virus/anti-malware, vulnerability management, data loss prevention (DLP), advanced persistent treat (APT), and policy compliance
5425.qualifications_html:
• At least 5 years of experience in an information security analyst/engineer role with a prior background in information technology.
  • A minimum of 12 years of total technology experience preferred. 
  • Advanced knowledge of common Information Security frameworks such as ISO 27001/2, Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology (CoBIT), Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) and National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) preferred.
  • Highly developed organizational skills and attention to detail including the ability to handle multiple projects and priorities simultaneously with a high degree of professionalism and client service orientation.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively including the ability to communicate security and risk-related concepts across all stakeholder groups (written and oral):  Executive team, management peers, and external customers.
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative, who can proactively identify issues/opportunities and recommend actions.
  • Strategic analysis/creative problem solving, business judgment and financial acumen are required.
  • High computer literacy; Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook).

5558.position_title: Account Executive - New Business - Majors High
5558.overview_html: We’re looking for a regionally-based, experienced sales professional to join our team as an Account Executive - New Business - Majors High, where you’ll help us achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within a regionally assigned market segment. In this role, you’ll proactively establish, develop and maintain effective business relationships with both prospective customers, to generate new business for iCIMS’ product suite, as well as introducing and selling into existing customers.   As an Account Executive - New Business - Majors High, you’ll have a unique opportunity to hit the ground running, building a solid book of business and helping blaze trails within our majors segment.
5558.responsibilities_html:
• Targets companies within segment (750 to 2499 employee size) that prioritize winning the war for talent and attracting the best people to their organization.
  • Drives new business and customer growth within assigned territory
  • Builds and maintains relationships with customers at all levels, including multiple personas up to senior leadership and C-suite, to assess needs and effectively link product value, features/benefits to those needs. Works internally to align appropriate team sell-approach.
  • Responsible for accurate pipeline management / reporting and monthly sales forecasts.
  • Follows well defined sales methodology to ensure prospects are a good fit for iCIMS’ long term.
  • Understands big picture of iCIMS’ product suite and how it can fit into client organization. Closes deals while setting stage for additional product sales within organization.
  • Ability to sell any of the iCIMS portfolio solutions dependent on customer’s maturity and specific needs based on thorough discovery and existing technology landscape.
  • Presents and positions iCIMS’ products/services to prospective customers via on site visits. Represents the iCIMS organization with professionalism and integrity.
  • Partners with iCIMS’ Sales Engineers and other subject matter experts to demonstrate product and service capabilities.
  • Builds sales funnels through prospecting efforts including but not limited to client referrals, regional networking, webinars and cold calling.
  • Follows-up and actions on new leads and referrals resulting from marketing and prospecting activity.
  • Develops and maintains detailed product and marketplace understanding to help prospective customers make well informed buying decisions.
  • Plans and organizes personal sales strategy by thoroughly understanding prospective customer’s business cycles and timing.
  • Prepares presentations, demonstrations, investment summaries, and sales contracts.
  • Closes deals of increasing size and complexity.
  • Effectively builds and maintains partnerships with clients, prospects and people at all levels across the company. Contributes to team and company success.
  • Consistently targets and closes deals while setting stage for additional product sales within organization.
  • Effectively interfaces with multiple departments within client organization, which could include executive level personas.
  • Mentors and motivates other members of the AE team.
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ core competencies, policies and procedures.

  • Coordinates sales efforts cross functionally with marketing, sales management, accounting, legal and technical service groups.
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and takes initiative when appropriate.
  • Maintains flexibility and reacts to change appropriately.

  • A minimum of 5 years of direct sales experience required.
  • At least 3 years of sales experience desirable, preferably in the HR / HCM space, Software, or Software-as-a-Service industry, but not essential.  
  • Proven ability to access power, leveraging established relationships and proven sales techniques for success.
  • Intermediate knowledge of the practices and principles related to sales techniques.
  • Able to effectively establish a plan and identify customer / business challenges inclusive of milestones, communications, usage of insights.
  • Consistently applies strategic approach to deal crafting and relationship building.
  • Proven track record in soliciting and closing B2B sales against a quota.
  • Demonstrated effectiveness in new business development strategies and lead qualification.
  • Ability to multi-task and handle multiple prospective clients and issues simultaneously.
  • Ability to clearly present and effectively overcome objections.
  • Demonstrated aptitude for problem-solving.
  • Able to work both independently and within a team environment.
  • Computer literate; proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively with appropriate empathy.
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth.
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative.
  • Understands how to approach sales from a strategic perspective.
  • Strong Results Orientation with a focus on closing long term sales cycles.
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation.  Creates and sustains ongoing forums that encourage two-way communication opportunities.

5846.responsibilities_html: iCIMS, Inc. seeks a Software Test Engineer III (Holmdel, NJ): Work on an agile team leveraging Agile methodologies to deliver high-quality deliverables for iCIMS’ SaaS Talent Acquisition platform. Collaborate with Product Development, Product Management and other cross functional groups to understand design, requirements of features and build out strong test strategy. Interact with development engineers to devise automation strategies, test strategies and test cases to automate new features and enhance existing functionality. Perform web, API, UI, functional, regression, smoke, black box, security, accessibility, I18N and end-to-end testing. Work with the team to design test scripts that allow for maximum reuse for all releases. Write and/or modify SQL queries to perform database validations. Independently tackle technical issues and take test ownership of one or more features that are being created and drive world class quality in not only the code but in the processes by which it is created and tested. Work with functional teams in reducing error rates and perform root cause analysis of errors/trends. Mentor level I & II Test Engineers
5846.qualifications_html: MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Master’s or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Technology and 3 years of software engineering experience in the latest version of Java, Selenium and version control systems; and 3 years working in Agile Scrum teams and partnering cross-functionally for company success. Alternatively, will accept Bachelor’s degree in these fields and 5 years of experience. Must have 3 years in at least 4 of the following: JAVA; RESTful services, SQL, HTML; CSS; JSON; JavaScript; Selenium Webdriver. Must have 2 years in designing and developing automation frameworks for web and mobile applications.

6518.overview_html: Are you Microsoft and ITIL-Certified? Have you provided white glove IT support to an executive leadership team? We’re looking for a proactive problem-solver with strong Active Directory skills to join our team as a Systems Administrator where you’ll be responsible for supporting our network infrastructure and providing IT support to our 800+ employees. In this role, you’ll conceptualize, design, implement and maintain IT Technology for our organization, identifying gaps, conducting evaluations and providing direction for enterprise solutions. You’ll serve as the subject matter expert (SME) on Microsoft Professional Suite, including SharePoint and OWA, and will be tasked with solving complex technical issues, serving as the top-tier escalation point for the Technical Support team. If you’re highly motivated with a strong customer-service orientation and passion for evolving systems and technologies, this could be a perfect fit.
6518.responsibilities_html:
• Provides expert level support for the Microsoft Professional Suite including SharePoint and OWA
  • Provides advanced administration on enterprise systems including but not limited to: Windows O/S, Apple OSx,
  • Active-Directory, Group Policy, Office365, DNS, DHCP, SSO.
  • Researches, designs and deploys technology including hardware, applications and peripherals
  • Evaluates existing systems and/or user needs to analyze, design, recommend, and implement system changes
  • Analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities and workflows.
  • Coordinates outages for applications, network and vendor incidents using the ITIL methodology.
  • Performs lifecycle management for operating systems and applications using the Microsoft System Center suite of products (maintain patching, updates, software deployments etc.)
  • Identify potential issues and proactively ensure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure accessibility
  • Implements preventative maintenance procedures and provides root cause analysis to stakeholders
  • Follows the ITIL approach towards projects, implementations, issues resolution, and change management.
  • Provide “White Glove” support to the Executive Leadership Team
  • Create presentations, diagrams, reports and other documentation as needed
  • Oversee the development of customized software and hardware requirements.
  • Plan and implement systems automation as required for better efficiency
  • Provide after hours and on-call support as needed.
  • Conducts training sessions and cross-trains other technical services positions to update and expand knowledge and skills
  • Consistently and successfully provide Level II and Level III Support
  • Maintains written and oral communications with customers, technical support staff, and management using e-mail, intranet, telephone, and technical support software alert features
  • Support remote employees using remote desktop support tools.
  • Project management skills / ability to handle multiple projects with competing priorities.
6518.qualifications_html:
• Minimum of 5 years related experience
  • Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) preferred.
  • SME in Microsoft O365 Application Administration (Outlook, Excel, Word, etc.)
  • ITIL Foundation Certification Preferred
  • SME (Subject Matter Expert) within Active Directory, SCCM, Azure and Intune
  • SME on Packaging, Imaging and Group Policies utilizing SCCM and Windows Deployment Tool (WDT)
  • Scripting skills (PowerShell, Microsoft, Batch etc.)
  • Proven working experience supporting and integrating iOS and Android platforms within a corporate environment.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively; ability to present to a group of stakeholders.
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, dynamic environment that is going through high growth
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative, who can proactively identify issues/opportunities and recommend actions.
  • Strong results orientation with a proven track record of flawless execution and strong attention to detail
  • Demonstrated best in class support services
6518.eeo: iCIMS is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

6555.overview_html: Are you a highly driven email-marketer? Do you possess a passion for optimization and learning? If so, then you may be our next marketing nurture associate, who will use email and other channels to support our outbound marketing team’s performance and engagement goals that impact revenue growth. You will use your meticulous attention to detail to devise campaigns that nurture prospects through the sales pipeline, share them with our marketing automation team for deployment to our expansive email database, and then manage, measure and optimize them. If you’re a team player looking to make your mark by using your innovative ideas to promote our brand and drive sales, then we would love to hear from you, so apply to today!
6555.responsibilities_html:
• Drives strategy and planning of all email nurture programs supporting product and promotional campaigns to iCIMS’ internal database
  • Carries out segmentation of the database and implements strategies to move marketing qualified leads into sales-ready opportunities
  • Aligns closely with Pardot execution team to ensure that promotions are sent in a timely manner
  • Stays abreast of and recommends email marketing best practices for segmentation and personalization
  • Interfaces with sales and marketing stakeholders to understand target account list and defines the best messaging, subject lines, and call to actions to support program goals
  • Collaborates with content team to identify suitable assets to leverage for account acceleration or long-term nurture
  • Manages development of email testing program, providing takeaways and recommendations to continually improve programming
  • Leverages marketing automation tools and CRM to track performance, analyze data trends against nurture goals, and report on sales revenue generated from email marketing efforts
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ core competencies
6555.qualifications_html:
• A minimum of 1 year of experience deploying, developing and optimizing email campaigns
  • Hands-on experience in Pardot or similar marketing automation system strongly preferred
  • Previous project management experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to work seamlessly in a team-oriented environment
  • Demonstrated flexibility, creativity and problem-solving skills
  • Strong results orientation with a proven track record of flawless execution and strong attention to detail
  • Advanced Microsoft Office proficiency, Salesforce.com, and HTML/CSS experience is a plus
  • Comfortable working in a demanding, fast-paced changing environment that is going through high growth
  • Believes in self and is passionate about learning and growing
  • Self-motivated, enthusiastic, and can easily switch gears to manage multiple project types

Education

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or comparable education/experience
