6629.overview_html: iCIMS is looking to add an Application Engineer to our Cloud Services team. As an Application Engineer, you’ll be responsible for identifying, developing, and providing support with enterprise software solutions for our growing employee base. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include conducting technical research, testing, and evaluating tools and methodologies to ensure compliance, best practices, and efficiency. The ideal candidate is a proven self-starter, can effectively manage multiple projects in a short period of time, and possesses the ability to present ideas and information in a clear manner for diverse audiences. If you have a strong customer mindset and are a critical thinker and creative problem solver, join our team today!
6629.responsibilities_html:
• Assist in development, deployment and maintenance of enterprise software applications.
  • Interact with business to understand application requirements to design and develop application modifications or new application functionality.
  • Proactively look for making improvements in respective application modules
  • Turn design requirements and prototypes into working applications
  • Document and create test cases
  • Engineer unit test code and provide end-to- end testing of new features and enhancements. Resolve escalations received through ticketing system, emails, and/or phone calls in a timely manner. 
  • Perform testing and validation of applications/software systems to ensure that applications work properly.
  • Participate in code reviews
  • Document complex procedures and processes
  • Oversee installation of software systems as well as monitoring of equipment.
  • Communicate with systems analysts, engineers and programmers to get information on project limitations, performance requirements and interfaces.
  • After an application has been released, they help customers with maintenance issues.
  • Consistently ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies
  • Receive and take action on feedback and lessons learned for continual professional improvement and development.
  • Take measures to enhance body of knowledge and skill set through training
  • Other duties as assigned
6629.qualifications_html:
• Understanding of and experience with object-oriented programming and relational databases.
  • Experience in developing Enterprise level integrations with SaaS based applications such as SalesForce, NetSuite, Ultimate, Concur, Adaptive, and Cornerstone.
  • Required experience with Java/.NET/SQL/C#. 
  • Experience with XML, JSON and other open-source Web 2.0 technologies a plus. 
  • Experience with implementing service-oriented architecture (SOA) and enterprise application integration (EAI) using technologies like Mulesoft and TIBCO
  • Experience in the customization and configuration of complex development with Salesforce.com, including: Triggers, Apex, Visualforce, SOQL, Lightning Components, REST/SOAP API connections etc.
  • Experience with business process modelling
  • Experience in Agile environment highly preferred
  • Experience using Git as part of a team
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation
  • Strong results orientation and sense of urgency
  • Active learner, passionate about improving skills

6701.overview_html: The Systems Engineer will be responsible for participating in the monitoring, design, configuration of network and infrastructure to support the core business. Additionally, this person will be responsible for the development of documentation artifacts, processes, best practice policies, and procedures.
6701.responsibilities_html:
• Design, deploy and support high performance, scalable, enterprise network infrastructure
  • Build out additional infrastructure to support M&A activities
  • Performance optimization and troubleshooting for production environment
  • Modifications to Switch Config and Monitoring
  • NAC Administration
  • VPN Services
  • Infrastructure monitoring and capacity planning
  • Administration of:
    • DHCP Services
    • Group Policy
    • Internal DNS Services
    • Mail Services (SMTP Relays, Exchange, Exchange Online, G-Suite)
    • File Services (DFS)
    • AD DS (FSMO roles, Schema changes, OU Structure, User and Group administration)
    • Syslog and Audit Collectors (Configure servers and network devices to log to collectors, support collector installations)
    • Backup Services (On-premise and Azure)
    • Antivirus (Policy config, server agents, monitoring)
    • Servers (Windows and Linux running on AHV, VMware, Azure)
    • IIS and Apache Web Servers
  • Azure Services
  • SSO and Azure AD Authentication Services (App registrations and SAML Config, Conditional Access)
  • Application Role Assignment and Management for Authorization or Access
  • Intune Tier 2 Support (MDM policy changes or feature rollout)
  • Core and Dev Infrastructure (Support architecture and engineering team with secure and reliable development resources)
  • WAN Connectivity and Networking (DIA circuit support and changes)
  • App Services (Azure logic apps or functions for automation)
  • Perform technical research and evaluation of new technologies and software tools
  • Consistently ensures that business is always conducted with integrity, policies are followed, and that behavior aligns with iCIMS core competencies
  • Remain current on emerging technologies via professional groups, trade magazines, internal and external training, independent research and study, and other avenues available.
6701.qualifications_html:
• A minimum of 8+ years hands-on Network/Infrastructure Engineering experience
  • Strong networking background – ability to design and troubleshoot network routing
  • Strong Azure experience
  • Strong scripting ability (PowerShell, Bash)
  • Working knowledge of networking protocols, standards and hardware, such as TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, HTTP, SMTP, FTP, SNMP, Log Management, IDS, Ethernet Switches, VLANs, Firewalls, Load Balancers
  • Ability to demonstrate strong analytical capabilities and technical knowledge by providing innovative yet supportable solutions
  • Exposure to large scale enterprise deployment technologies – clustering, high availability, load balancing
  • Ability to architect, design and present scalability strategies to management
  • Strong ability to multi-task and effectively manage multiple competing priorities
  • Excellent oral, documentation, and presentation skills a must

 

Nice to Haves

 

  • AWS Experience
  • Ansible
  • Aruba Clearpass
  • Fortigate Firewall

 

Education/Certifications/Licenses Required

  • BS/MS in Information Technology/Computer Science or combination of education and equivalent work experience

6731.overview_html: Calling all business development professionals! Are you committed to providing a customer experience second to none? We’re seeking a proactive problem-solver who’s passionate about relationship building to join our team as an Account Executive – Customer – Majors Core, where you’ll help us achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within the Majors segment.  In this role, you’ll proactively establish, develop and maintain effective business relationships with existing customers, to generate new business for our product suite.   You’ll work closely with our customers to fully understand their business strategies, expectations and needs, promoting renewals, expansions, and ensuring overall satisfaction. To succeed, you’ll need to be able to readily identify growth opportunities and potential risks to the partnership, as well as expertly navigate executive-level conversations. If you’re a tactful communicator with a caring touch, let’s talk!
6731.responsibilities_html:
Building Relationships: Delivers a customer experience second to none. 

  • Conducts Executive Business Reviews to develop a deep understanding of the client’s needs and pain points with thoughtful, smart and creative dialogue. Links iCIMS’ products back to key business issues. 
  • Proactively engages with clients to determine ongoing satisfaction, provide demonstrated value of iCIMS products and services and emphasizes the client’s return on investment.  

 

Revenue: Builds partnerships through best in class full suite talent acquisition strategies. 

  • Proactively solicits and drives new business within assigned accounts.
  • Creates and manages pipeline of revenue opportunities from within existing customer base of assigned segment.
  • Maintains accurate and timely customer, pipeline, and forecast data.
  • Asks thoughtful questions and displays effective listening.
  • Assesses customer needs and effectively links product value, features/benefits to those needs.
  • Works with internal resources to present and position company products and services to new divisions of existing clients.
  • Develops and maintains current product knowledge and can explain the business value of our offerings.
  • Prepares presentations, demonstrations, investment summaries, and sales contracts.
  • Creates, monitors and manages a sales pipeline to ensure consistent achieve of quotas and metrics.

 

Retention: Leverages adoption to build long term relationships. 

  • Creates, monitors and manages a loss pipeline to ensure consistent achieve of quotas and metrics.
  • Proactively engages with customers to identify at-risk situations; escalating those instances to the appropriate resources within iCIMS who will execute those transactions. 
  • Monitors adoption, engagement and usage of iCIMS talent acquisition platform relevant to each customer to identify risk to the partnership.
  • Manages business escalation issues as they relate ongoing customer retention. Routes all other escalation issues to the appropriate iCIMS’ support teams or other iCIMS’ resources.
  • Manages the contract renewal process inclusive of affirming and/or reestablishing the value of iCIMS software to all key client stakeholders and presenting our long-term vision as a technology partner.
  • Maintains accurate and current records of customer interactions and transactions, recording details of inquiries, complaints, and comments, as well as actions taken.

 

Compliance and due diligence 

  • Proactively engages in professional development on an ongoing basis. 
  • Takes steps to develop industry knowledge and influence customer Talent Acquisition operations by recommending industry best practices inside and outside of the iCIMS product suite.  
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ core competencies, policies and procedures.
  • Uses Salesforce CRM to accurately track and record sales activity to ensure that metrics can be consistently measured.
6731.qualifications_html:
• Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent combination of education and work experience. 
  • A minimum of 1+ years of account management or customer relationship management experience desirable, preferably in the HR services, HCM, or Software-as-a-Service space or equivalent HR talent platform. 
  • Basic understanding of fundamentals of Human Resources and employment process. 
  • Displays capacity to negotiate deals with more than one point of contact inside customer organizations to satisfactory revenue requirements. 
  • Passionate about problem solving, relationship building and creating customer loyalty.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.  Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively.
  • Basic sales acumen and drive to participate in a sales environment with quota responsibilities 
  • Exceptional time and project management skills.  Ability to manage workload while understanding return on time investment.
  • Able to communicate with and influence multiple layers within organizations. 
  • Ability to clearly present material and effectively overcome objections.
  • High degree of comfort managing multiple, competing priorities in ambiguous environments.
  • Computer literate; proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook).
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth.
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative, who can proactively identify issues/opportunities and recommend actions. 
  • Strong results orientation with a proven track record of flawless execution and strong attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated flexibility, resilience and creativity when solving for complex issues.
  • Ability to multi-task and handle multiple clients and issues simultaneously.
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation.  Ability to effectively create and sustain ongoing forums that encourage two-way communication opportunities.
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team environment.

6739.overview_html: Are you a Strong Systems Engineer with a Cloud background?  Are you familiar with working in production environments and automating processes?  We’re looking for a hands-on team player with Linux Admin, performance optimization and scripting experience to join our team as a Systems Engineer III, where you’ll contribute to the design and delivery of hosting technologies for internal products. In this role, you will develop processes, policies and procedures, and will be responsible for code deploys, infrastructure building (InfraCode), email and FTP administration, in addition to break/fix and capacity planning. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants exposure to large-scale enterprise deployment technologies in the cloud, including clustering/high availability and load balancing. If you’re an analytically-minded, expert multitasker, and cool under pressure, this job is a perfect fit for you!
6739.responsibilities_html:

of mission critical SaaS applications
• Act as a primary point of contact for the System Engineering group
• Lead system engineering projects and initiatives

• Enterprise Architecture Knowledge
• Working knowledge of networking protocols, standards and hardware, such as TCP/IP, DHCP,

• Ability to demonstrate strong analytical capabilities and technical knowledge by providing
innovative yet supportable solutions
• Exposure to large scale enterprise deployment technologies – clustering/high availability, load
balancing

6752.overview_html: Software Engineer IV (SEIV) will be part of a team of some of the best and brightest in the industry who are focused on full-cycle development scalable web and responsive applications that touch our growing customer base every day.   As part of the Labs team, SEIV will work collaboratively with agile team members to architect new system functionality and to research and remedy complex issues as they arise, embodying a passion for continuous improvement and test-driven development. The SEIV will report to the Manager of Software Engineering.
6752.responsibilities_html:
• Architect, design and implement new features and perform code reviews 
  • Ability to have expertise broadly across all our products 
  • Visibility to competitors 
  • Build flexible/scalable test frameworks without over-engineering and choose simple, straightforward solutions over more complex ones, using known existing solutions  
  • Using engineering best practices, design, develop, analyze test plans and strategies to meet performance, usability, scalability, reliability and security needs 
  • Partner with Dev Managers, Scrum Masters in Release and Sprint planning 
  • Review technologies and development best practices for improving product and processes 
  • Research and fix challenging and complex issues as they arise 
  • Proactively search for making improvements across products, platforms, and modules 
  • Mentor Software Engineers (II-III) 
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ policies, procedures, and core competencies.
6752.qualifications_html:
• Create external value through patent, white paper, speaker at conferences. Creates brand and company equity 
  • Advanced Expertise in several of the following back-end or front-end: Java, Python, JavaScript, iOS development (Swift, Objective C), Android development 
  • Advanced Expertise in several of the following frameworks or libraries, such as: Hibernate and Spring, Reactjs and Redux, node.js 
  • Advanced proficiency with several advanced design patterns including Visitor, Interpreter, Prototype 
  • Expertise in test automation tools, such as Selenium Webdriver, Appium or similar tools 
  • Expertise in Java and JavaScript testing frameworks, such as JUnit, TestNG, JEST, Jasmine or similar 
  • Advanced expertise in test design, test creation, test execution and defect analysis/root cause investigation on a large-scale enterprise software 
  • Experience in advocating and evangelizing best practices such as Test Driven Development (TDD), behavioral-driven development (BDD), Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) 
  • Expertise utilizing Docker containerization, setting-up build and release tools such as, Jenkins and AWS elastic beanstalk. 
  • Research emerging software engineering practices, philosophies and techniques and recommends changes to the organization 
  • Evangelize Agile/SCRUM techniques for the organization 
  • Ability to influence organizationally, lead and organize initiatives that cross product and portfolio boundaries 
  • Create best practices and guide teams to anticipate issues/opportunities when building solutions 

 

 

Education/Certifications/Licenses Required 
 
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or other technical degree and 5 years of software engineering experience or 3 years of experience developing recruiting software.  
 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or other technical degree and 5 years of experience developing recruiting software or 7 years of software engineering experience.  
 
In lieu of bachelor’s or technical degree, we will accept 2 additional years of software engineering experience.

6754.overview_html: Are you a product owner or systems designer with experience in recruitment advertising or talent relationship management? Are you familiar with Agile methodologies and the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)? We’re seeking a driven, articulate problem-solver to join our team as a Business Analyst (BA) II, where you’ll be assigned items from our recruitment advertising product road map and asked to create requirements/user stories and acceptance criteria by eliciting feedback from internal and external stakeholders. As a BA, you’ll work closely with our architecture, development, and testing teams to ensure their user stories and acceptance criteria are clearly defined, and collaborate with customers to demo new features, synthesize feedback and report it back to the teams. We’re looking for someone who has a solid understanding of product ownership and can present to senior leadership with confidence. If you’re a results-oriented self-starter with a customer service mindset, then we’d love to bring you on board!
6754.responsibilities_html:
• Understand vision, direction and priority of the Product Backlog as it relates to their teams modules
  • Define the Product Backlog of their teams modules during release planning
  • Attends all required Scrum meetings (Sprint Planning, Product Backlog Grooming, Sprint Review)
  • Facilitates requirements modelling sessions
  • Creates mock-ups or wireframes to express functional requirements
  • Communicates requirements through epics and user stories so they are understood
  • Holds team accountable to their commitments for developing features during sprint cycles
  • Triages team support tickets within company Service Level Agreement and making the determination as to what will be addressed by team and in what timeframe.
  • Develops a deep understanding of the customer’s needs through direct and indirect contact
  • Is the “go-to” person for information software module’s assigned
  • Educates stakeholders in the development process
  • Removes barriers between the team and stakeholders
  • Provides consistent feedback regarding the prioritization of enhancements based on customer feedback, market changes and business priority.
  • Documents the user perceivable changes of the features their teams worked on so the documentation team can successfully create supporting materials
  • Makes recommendations regarding accepting or rejecting their agile teams work results at each Sprint Review meeting
  • Provides the team clear information on iCIMS customers and potential customers including how they use the product, why they use the product, who uses it and when they use it.

6758.overview_html: Is your background in Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI)? Do you have software industry experience? We’re looking for a skilled cross-functional collaborator with a solid understanding of AI concepts and strong skillset in ML and NLP libraries to join our data engineering team as a Machine Learning Engineer III, where you’ll focus on developing products and experiences for our growing customer base. As a Machine Learning Engineer III, you’ll work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Architects on new initiatives, helping to build out our product’s AI capabilities. If you’re proactive, transparent, and eager to help shape the direction of AI/ML projects, this could be your next big thing.

  • Lead and collaborate with agile team members on achieving Sprint deliverables

6777.overview_html: Have you negotiated a high volume of complex contracts? Are you used to working with client-facing teams? We’re looking for a creative problem-solver who’s cool under pressure to join our team as an Associate Counsel, where you’ll provide commercial contracting support and legal counsel for various business teams throughout the organization. In this role, you’ll be working with name brand, global vendors, partners and customers to help us negotiate complex, SaaS agreements and other contracts. You’ll negotiate issues relating to data privacy and security matters, provide legal and contract support for our extensive vendor marketplace, and help us negotiate strategic partnerships. To succeed, you’ll need to be able to expertly identify nuanced legal issues with an eye to our business needs, and devise ways for the business to forge ahead when faced with potential roadblocks. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a fast-growing, evolving technology company and help drive exciting new initiatives. If you’re an organized, self-starter who lives for closing a deal, let’s chat!
6777.responsibilities_html:
The role will focus on the following key areas:
• Negotiate global customer and vendor contracts, including, subscription, software licensing and services arrangements, and business partner and alliance agreements.
• Assist in managing vendor relationships and building effective partnerships, while helping to lower costs and secure agreements.
• Assist in developing and managing customer and vendor contracting processes, and providing legal and compliance advice on account and vendor management contracts and other issues.
• Work with the team to drive compliance, through interacting with the business to understand potential legal compliance issues, engaging with internal area of law subject matter experts, reviewing and understanding applicable laws and regulations applicable to iCIMS’ business, and helping to ensure adoption and execution of internal policies and procedures.
• Help ensure intellectual property protection and enforcement, including copyrights, trade secrets, and patents, as applicable.
• Conduct research on a variety of legal issues.
• Consistently ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies
6777.qualifications_html:
• A minimum of 1 year of experience negotiating complex software as a service, software licensing, professional services, and/or other technology transactions is required. 2+ years of related experience is preferred.
• Knowledge of federal, state, local and foreign laws and regulations.
• Ability to analyze case law and provide recommendations, and draft memoranda and guidelines on the application of laws and regulations.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
• Strong customer orientation focus and success in creating a superior Customer Experience.
• Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with company employees.
• Demonstrated success in displaying passion, drive, adaptability and innovation.
• Ability to organize and manage multiple, and at times competing priorities.
• Demonstrated ability to solve practical problems or resolve issues in a timely manner.
• Proficient in the MS Office Suite.
• Ability to thrive in a fast paced, growing organization.
• Ability to build solid working relationships within various areas/business functions of the company.


Education/Certifications/Licenses Required

• Membership in the State Bar as an attorney qualified to practice law in the State of NJ or eligible to become licensed as an in-house counsel

6790.overview_html:
iCIMS is looking for an aspiring Data Analyst to join our Finance team and partner closely with our Data Governance and Decision Support specialists to source, analyze, reconcile and report on business analytics and trends.   iCIMS specializes in HR Technology so that means that as a Data Analyst Intern, you will be identifying and defining problems that span all the lines of business operations. Problems involve understanding and working with very large volumes of business and customer data that is used for both operational and strategic business reporting.

 

You’ll work closely with Finance and Data Governance team members to identify problems, plan your data analysis project and present your results and findings to a variety of audiences that will include other members of the Finance staff and business leaders. The Finance and Data Governance groups are responsible for ensuring that our CRM data is accurate, reflective of appropriate history, reportable, and enables effective business decision making.  These business partners manage and provide oversight of our organization's financial data and assets to help provide business users with high-quality data that is easily accessible in a consistent manner.

 

As a Data Analyst intern, you’ll create a variety of data driven materials based on public and proprietary data. You’ll explore the relationship between our data sets and how it enables effective decision making within the organization.
6790.responsibilities_html:
• Analyzing and reporting on business data
  • Data migration and reconciliation
  • Building data-driven science models
  • Extracting knowledge or insights from data in various forms to enable business decision making
  • Optimizing structured or unstructured data analysis

• This role requires an exceptional eye for detail and outstanding analytical abilities.
  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills. 
  • A Finance or Accounting major is preferred.
  • Presentation skills and confidence presenting to large groups
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth
  • This is a paid internship with hands-on training and responsibilities
  • Must be pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree during the time of the internship (Summer 2019)

Are you passionate about visual and user-centered design? We’re looking for a flexible, highly-motivated self-starter to join our team as a UI/UX Intern, where you’ll collaborate with other UI/UX designers, developers and our Sales team and assist in developing and curating UI/UX component libraries and design patterns. You’ll help develop prototypes and conduct usability testing in support of web and mobile experiences, and aid in the creation of research and usability plans. 6814.overview_html: Are you a Strong Systems Engineer with a Cloud background?  Are you familiar with working in production environments and automating processes?  We’re looking for a hands-on team player with Linux Admin, performance optimization and scripting experience to join our team as a Systems Engineer II, where you’ll contribute to the design and delivery of hosting technologies for internal products. In this role, you will develop processes, policies and procedures, and will be responsible for code deploys, infrastructure building (InfraCode), email and FTP administration, in addition to break/fix and capacity planning. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants exposure to large-scale enterprise deployment technologies in the cloud, including clustering/high availability and load balancing. 6815.overview_html: Attention all experienced recruiters! We’re looking for a recruiting rockstar and trusted business partner to join our team as a Recruiter, where you’ll help us source and hire top talent across multiple areas of the business. As a Recruiter, you’ll be responsible for devising creative, outbound sourcing strategies, providing a best-in-class candidate experience and working closely with the rest of the TA team. You’ll need to provide a hands-on, end-to-end consultative approach, working closely with senior leaders to help them think through what they’re looking for, asking the right questions, and when necessary, guiding them in the right direction. This is a unique opportunity for a consultative recruiter to join a fast-growing technology company that builds best-in-class applicant tracking software—software that you’ll be able to use in your day-to-day. If you live and breathe recruiting and are obsessed with identifying top talent and making great hires, this is right up your alley!

6822.overview_html: Do you have a background in account management, business development or alliance/partnership?  Have you worked in the strategic advisory space with a focus on HR Transformation? You’ll own the day-to-day interactions with each point of contact, and will be responsible for new business generation associated with each partner.  We’re looking for someone who’s thoroughly comfortable communicating with, and influencing, members of senior leadership. 6831.overview_html: Calling all SEO gurus! Do you want to take the next step in your career at a cutting-edge technology company where you can own the SEO strategy, and analyze and optimize our SEO programs? If so, then you may be the person who we need to fill our opening for an SEO analyst II, which will place you on the UX/web-services team in our marketing department, where you will play a key role in continuing the success of our SEO programs and driving high-quality organic traffic to our web properties. Day to day, you will focus on our keyword strategy, content architecture, and lead our in-house content and technology teams in the latest organic optimization trends. If that sounds like a role that speaks to your passion, then apply now!
6831.responsibilities_html:
• Direct iCIMS’ marketing divisions on technical, social, and conceptual SEO execution.
  • Enhance content for Search Engine Optimization to increase high-quality traffic and conversion volume of corporate website.
  • Work cross-departmentally to align marketing messaging with SEO best practices to ensure relevancy and consistency for target audience.
  • Provide keyword research to support content marketing and product marketing teams.
  • Align with the SEM team to ensure that tracked keywords are keyword targets that have a proven return on investment in the form of market qualified leads and sales opportunities.
  • Drive optimization efforts through tactical keyword discovery, landing page optimization, testing, and analysis in partnership with SEM team.
  • Monitor and track company’s rankings within Google SERPs.
  • Report on revenue-generated organic opportunities to determine overall effectiveness of SEO activities.
  • Research and educate company on SEO trends including on-page and off-page success factors.
  • Assist UX team with metric gathering and optimization strategies.
  • Prepare quarterly reporting on organic metrics to senior leadership.
  • Manage SEO vendor relationships.
6831.qualifications_html:
• Min of 3 Years' of experience in Search Engine Optimization/Marketing.
  • Proven track record of developing successful SEO strategies.
  • Google Analytics certification preferred.
  • Comfortable working in a demanding, fast-paced environment.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Undergraduate degree from a 4-year university ideally with a focus in Marketing, Management, Finance, or Business Administration desired.
  • Experience in client presentation and consulting skills
  • Basic project management knowledge including estimating engagement and effort, duration.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize components of short - and long-term projects and escalations.
  • Proven ability to work well with cross-functional teams to achieve results.

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on SEO experience with a strong technical focus.
  • Experience with analytics (Google Analytics), rank monitoring, and database tools, including the leading SEO software tools: Screaming Frog, Ahrefs, SEMRush, and MOZ.
  • Experience with Ninja Outreach, Buzzstream or other leading backlink outreach tools.
  • Experience in link audits and creating link disavow files.
  • HTML skills, page speed monitoring, Indexation & Page Titles, tags and meta data management.
  • Site linking and content audit experience.
  • Qualification in statistics, economics, accounting, math, engineering, market research or other data-driven field.
  • Knowledge with technical aspects of search engines.
  • Familiarity with Google Search Console versions 1 and 2.
  • Familiarity with Voice Search & Semantic Markup
  • Familiarity with using Bing Webmasters Tools.
  • Experience working with and optimizing SEO within CMS environments.
  • Experience with A/B and/or multivariate testing.
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel.

 

Content Management Experience

  • Content Management: Experience in managing large sets of URLS and their meta robots condition to ensure that pages are not hit with a Google Core Quality Update or Google Panda Algorithm.
  • Crawlability: Technical aspects of SEO such as, 301 redirects, 404 errors, site speed, server responsiveness, robot.txt files, no follow and NOINDEX directives. (understanding performance of the website
  • Rank ability:  On-page optimization such as keyword research, title and description tags, H tags, and keyword density/frequency, as well as internal linking, and link sculpting.
  • Content Marketing: Inbound marketing focus around giving input on quality content and then working on off-site optimization such as link acquisition & content sharing to promote that content.
  • Usability and Conversion Optimization: Focusing on data to improve site layout, functionality and conversions tied to business objectives.

6835.overview_html: Are you somebody who loves to dig into the data? Do you possess a passion for harnessing the powerful insights uncovered by data analysis to solve customers’ problems? If so, then you may be the person who we need to fill an opening in our product organization for a product manager, who will oversee the roadmap of our complex and strategic data initiatives that rely on analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning to identify key insights! As a critical component of our larger talent-acquisition platform, our data helps us, as well as our partners and customers adhere to a more efficient and informed hiring process. Additionally, it supports our status as a thought leader on the cutting edge of the latest hiring trends, which we share with analysts, the media and others. On top of that, the role will require you to establish strong relationships with numerous technical and nontechnical stakeholders across our business, at our customers and throughout the developer community. In doing so, you will assess risks, anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, make trade-offs, balance business needs versus technical constraints and encourage risk-taking behavior to maximize business benefit. If you’re up for the challenge, and love to roll up your sleeves, learn new technologies, explore data, and provide the needed balance between technical and business leadership, then apply now!
6835.responsibilities_html:
• Work closely with customers, other portfolio product managers, iCIMS sales and customer success teams, and leadership in establishing long-range strategic plans/roadmaps for AI/ML and analytics
  • Identify, define and drive development of new products/solutions and business opportunities for iCIMS driven by data and AI/ML
  • Provide business requirements for new services and work with Architects, Product Owners/BAs, and Technical Leads to drive solutioning
  • Own the execution of key strategic and complex programs and successfully deliver on time in an Agile environment
  • Define roadmaps for AI/ML services for iCIMS platform
  • Utilize data exploration skills and curiosity to understand customer needs and improve data quality
  • Research and understand commercially available data analytics and AI/ML platforms to drive build vs buy decisions
  • Report on the status of the key initiatives at various levels.
6835.qualifications_html:
Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Management Information Systems or related field preferred 
  • At least 5 years of experience in information technology field
  • At least 2 years of experience as a Technical Program/Product Manager
  • Familiarity with big data and analytics
  • A passion for working with large-scale, high customer impact data systems
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to communicate and influence effectively across all levels
  • Track record of delivering results, ownership, and strong customer focus
  • Proven analytical thinking, attention to details, and exceptional organizational skill

Desired Qualifications:

 

  • Master's degree or equivalent experience
  • Solid understanding of structured and unstructured data frameworks
  • Experience in using BI and Visualization tools
  • Good understanding of API and microservices.

6841.overview_html: Attention partnership experts! Do you crave a management opportunity that will empower you to operationalize everything that makes strategic partnerships possible? If so, then you may be the person who we need to fill our opening for an associate manager of partner operations, a new position that will optimize the framework that makes our revenue-generating partner program tick! You will define our partner processes and systems, such as how we gauge success, and handle advocacy and commission. You will then ensure that all partner-related teams — which handle marketing, onboarding, development and enablement — adhere to them. If you possess a background in analytics, marketing and operations, then we want to hear from you, so apply today!
6841.responsibilities_html:
• In collaboration with Associate Director, Partnerships, manages and Kaizens the People, Practice and Systems framework for the Partner operations teams including Partner Development, Partner Onboarding, Partner Marketing and Enablement.
  • Develops and manages execution of the partner additions/partner development strategies for the ecosystem.
  • Develops and manages execution of the partner Market Development Fund (MDF) strategies.
  • Own the calculation, validation, and delivery of partners performance within the parameters of the program.
  • Own the curation and enhancement of all digital properties and communication channels that our partners leverage to support their iCIMS relationship.
  • Responsible for the overall partner enablement operation to ensure information on our partners is readily available to iCIMS internal stakeholders, and that program information is communicated timely to all iCIMS partners.
  • Oversee the strategy and execution of all partner related events, including the iCIMS Partner Summit.
  • Oversee the administration of our Partner Onboarding Program and ensure training resources given to partners are relevant and support the overall goals of driving engaged revenue generating partnerships.
  • Guides, develops, and supports direct reports; maintain weekly 1:1’s
  • Own the overarch structure and enhancement of both the iCIMS Partner Program and the iCIMS Advisor Program Contracts, ensuring each are review annually by relevant stakeholders, and that updates are made and communicated effectively to all impacted partners.
  • Builds and maintains cross-departmental relationships and alignment to maximize the benefits that we offer to our partners, and the benefits that our partners provide for iCIMS.
  • Structure team goals and operations to align directly to the revenue goals of the Partner Relationship Management team.
  • Communicates risks and performance data in a way that impacts our product and service roadmaps to improve the experience and results for future partners.
  • Drive a high-performance team following Talent policies, processes & timelines with respect to Performance Management.
  • Structures appropriate training and development to eliminate roadblocks to team performance to execute the strategic direction of the department and motivate the team to deliver consistent results.
6841.qualifications_html:
• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in partner support functions
  • Minimum of 1 year experience managing people
  • Experience managing an operation driven function within a high-growth business climate a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to support revenue generation goals within a partnership function.
  • Strong ability hire, motivate, and lead people leaders and create a high-performance team culture.
  • Solid presentation skills; ability to communicate to large partner audiences
  • Ability to lead internal and external teams and provide cross-functional leadership.
  • Experience with the MS Office Suite and MS Outlook required.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively. 
  • Ability to review and approve content in line with approved corporate messaging.
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment that is experiencing high growth.
  • A self-starter who takes the initiative, someone who can proactively identify issues/opportunities and recommend solutions.
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation.  Creates and sustains ongoing forums that encourage two-way communication opportunities.

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent combination of education and work experience.

6842.overview_html: Are you an effective communicator looking to build a career in project or program management? Do you know how to achieve project goals in a rapidly shifting environment? We’re looking for a natural-born leader and skilled cross-functional collaborator to join our team as an Agile Engineering Program Manager I, where you’ll manage a wide array of projects within Cloud Operations, including data migrations, the rollout of new applications and new microservices. You’ll develop deep partnerships with different stakeholders across the business and will be responsible for shepherding the implementation of infrastructure from problem definition and proof-of-concept all the way out to deployment and initial support, building out project plans, scheduling meetings and delivering regular status updates. If you’re a highly organized, expert prioritizer who knows how to run a meeting and accommodate various work styles, then you’re just who we’re looking for.
6842.responsibilities_html:
•      Create, implement, and maintain project plans and status updates

•      Play a consultative role at the team level to help put in place the appropriate processes and tools as needed to optimize the efficiency of the project team and the department

•      Define project scope and schedule for assigned projects while focusing on regular and timely delivery of value through the implementation and maintenance of project plans and status updates

•      Organize and lead project status and working meetings as well as prepare and distribute progress reports

•      Identify technical and non-technical project stakeholders and ensure they are engaged at the appropriate times throughout the project

•      Manage project risks, dependencies and issues:  escalate and track impediments; correct deviations from plans; and perform delivery planning for assigned projects.  Provide input on resourcing to address          critical bottlenecks and communicate critical issues and potential solutions in a timely manner

•      Facilitate the improvement of existing tools and processes to improve cross-collaboration and the customer experience

•      Ensure customers and the business are ready for the deployment and operation of  new infrastructure technology into production

•      Influence and communicate cross functionally

•      Foster team predictability using metrics as an input into future planning

•      Work with 3rd party vendors as necessary to ensure deliverables relevant to projects

•      Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies
6842.qualifications_html:
•      Demonstrated ability to manage projects and achieve project objectives

•      Strong analytical, planning, organizational, and follow-up skills

•      Solid understanding of the project management life cycle

•      Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with teams from multiple stakeholder groups

•      Knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment

•      Demonstrated ability to learn and understand new technical concepts

•      0-2 years working with cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS or Azure

•      0-2 years working with SaaS products

•      Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite, including Microsoft Project and Visio

•      Proficient with the Atlassian Suite, including Confluence and JIRA Software

•      Effective verbal and written communication skills

•      Creative approach to problem solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view

 

 

 

Education/Certifications/Licenses Required

·         Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Engineering, or other technical degree, or relevant experience

6855.overview_html: We’re looking for a regionally-based, experienced sales professional to join our team as a Account Executive– Customer Base – Enterprise (South-East / Mid-West), where you’ll help us achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within a strategically defined market segment. In this role, you’ll proactively establish, develop and maintain effective business relationships with existing customers to generate new business for our product suite.   As an Account Executive– Customer Base, you’ll have a unique opportunity to hit the ground running, building a solid book of business and helping blaze trails in our enterprise space.
6855.responsibilities_html:
• Targets companies within segment that prioritize winning the war for talent and attracting the best people to their organization.
  • Drives new business and customer growth within assigned territory
  • Builds and maintains relationships with customers at all levels, including senior leadership and C-suite, to assess needs and effectively link product value, features/benefits to those needs. Works internally to align appropriate team sell-approach.
  • Follows well defined sales methodology to ensure prospects are a good fit for iCIMS’ long term.
  • Understands big picture of iCIMS’ product suite and how it can fit into client organization. Closes deals while setting stage for additional product sales within organization.
  • Ability to sell any of the iCIMS portfolio solutions dependent on customer’s maturity and specific needs based on thorough discovery and existing technology landscape.
  • Presents and positions iCIMS’ products/services to customers via on site visits. Represents the iCIMS organization with professionalism and integrity.
  • Partners with iCIMS’ Sales Engineers and other subject matter experts to demonstrate product and service capabilities.
  • Builds sales funnels through prospecting efforts including but not limited to client referrals, regional networking, webinars and cold calling.
  • Follows-up and actions on new leads and referrals resulting from marketing and prospecting activity.
  • Develops and maintains detailed product and marketplace understanding to help customers make well informed buying decisions.
  • Plans and organizes personal sales strategy by thoroughly understanding the account’s business cycles and timing.
  • Prepares presentations, demonstrations, investment summaries, and sales contracts.
  • Closes deals of significant size, complexity and sales cycle length.
  • Effectively builds and maintains partnerships with clients, prospects and people at all levels across the company. Contributes to team and company success.
  • Consistently targets and closes deals of significant complexity while setting stage for additional product sales within organization.
  • Effectively interfaces with multiple departments within client organization including C – Suite.
  • Mentors and motivates other members of the AE team.
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ core competencies, policies and procedures.
6855.qualifications_html:
• Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
  • A minimum of 8 years of sales experience desirable, preferably in the HR / HCM space, Software, or Software-as-a-Service industry, but not essential.  
  • At least 5 years of Enterprise sales experience required.
  • A minimum of 3 years of sales experience with a Human Capital Management system preferred.
  • Superior knowledge of the practices and principles related to sales techniques.
  • Skilled at closing deals that are more advanced in scope and size.  Customers consistently have significant elements of complexity (i.e. decentralized or with multiple business units / brands, global presence).
  • Adept at transferring knowledge and passion for sales to junior staff.
  • Consistently applies strategic approach to deal crafting and relationship building.
  • Proven track record in soliciting and closing B2B sales against a quota.
  • Demonstrated effectiveness in new business development strategies and lead qualification.
  • Ability to multi-task and handle multiple accounts and issues simultaneously.
  • Proven ability to leverage established relationships and proven sales techniques for success.
  • Ability to clearly present and effectively overcome objections.
  • Demonstrated aptitude for problem-solving.
  • Able to work both independently and within a team environment.
  • Computer literate; proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively with appropriate empathy.
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth.
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative.
  • Understands how to approach sales from a strategic perspective.
  • Strong Results Orientation with a focus on closing long term sales cycles.
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation.  Creates and sustains ongoing forums that encourage two-way communication opportunities.
  • Able to communicate with and influence multiples layers of organizations, including Senior Leadership. Through a constant presence, becomes aware of changes in a customer’s organization and alters sales plan accordingly.
  • Effective at developing and maintaining client relationships at senior management (C– Suite) levels within Enterprise sized companies.
  • Ability to travel 35 - 50%.

6856.overview_html: Do you have top-notch communication skills? Have you developed deep relationships with partners and/or clients? We’re looking for a poised, professional self-starter who understands the landscape of the HR space to join our team as a Partner Relationship Manager, where you’ll serve as the face of the company and grow relationships with existing and potential partners in our partner ecosystem. In this role, you’ll be responsible for developing partner relations strategies and initiatives to grow our partners’ revenue contribution to iCIMS, as well as developing marketing campaigns, external communications, and, hitting the road as needed to meet with our partners face-to-face. You’ll identify key partners and revenue generating opportunities with those partners, as well as coach current and potential partners on our product suite and the iCIMS value proposition. If you’re highly driven, love working with people, and know how to work a room, this might be the job for you!
6856.responsibilities_html:
• Manage a group of 30-60 partners
  • Masterfully present iCIMS value proposition to our existing partner ecosystem
  • Work closely with the Partner Onboarding Specialist and Partner Marketing Specialist to ensure each partner is getting the appropriate exposure and attention within iCIMS
  • Own relationships with established partners with proven value for iCIMS and high growth potential.
  • Work cross-departmentally to ensure all partner needs are effectively addressed
  • Demonstrate and train others on the iCIMS product suite, and show partners how to convey our value proposition effectively to their clients and prospects
  • Qualify opportunities generated from our partner ecosystem with a focus on the Enterprise segment
  • Support important relationships with existing referral partners
  • Assist in the development and future direction of the iCIMS partner tier program.
  • Serve as a first level of escalation for partner related issues.
  • Act as the reporting POC for all metric related inquiries from internal stakeholders.
  • Meet and Exceed referral opportunity quotes on a monthly basis from an individual book of partners
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and takes initiative
  • Maintains flexibility and reacts to change appropriately
  • Receives and takes action on feedback and lessons learned for continual professional improvement and development
  • Takes measures to enhance body of knowledge and skill set through training
  • 25% Travel
  • Other duties as assigned
6856.qualifications_html:
• A minimum of 3 years’ experience in an account or channel management role
  • Ability to clearly present material
  • Effective organizational and project management skills required
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills required
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to work seamlessly in a team oriented environment
  • Demonstrated flexibility, creativity and a proactive approach to problem solving
  • Strong results orientation with a proven track record of flawless execution and strong attention to detail
  • Advanced Microsoft Office proficiency
  • Comfortable working in a demanding, fast-paced changing environment that is going through high growth
  • Believes in self and is passionate about learning and growing
  • Positive attitude and desire to grow with department and company

Education:

  • Undergraduate degree from a competitive school with a strong academic track record, or equivalent experience

6868.overview_html: Calling all creative storytellers! Do you excel at cross-departmental collaboration? Do you have experience answering RFP/RFIs? We’re seeking an exceptional writer with superior project management skills to join our team as a Proposal Writer, where you’ll oversee the simultaneous development of multiple RFP responses for our suite of products and services, working cross-functionally with our Sales and Legal teams to make an impact in our ability to win deals. As a Proposal Writer, you’ll be responsible for understanding both prospect and client needs and managing the RFP response from start to finish: from authoring and editing content to finalizing and submitting responses. You’ll utilize core messaging, product positioning content and our existing answer bank to develop compelling answers to the questions outlined in each proposal, while ensuring all responses are accurate, timely and are in keeping with iCIMS company standards, brand and direction. If you’re a strong writer who’s exceedingly nimble, detail-oriented and capable of thinking quickly on your feet, this could be your next big thing.
6868.responsibilities_html:
• Oversees the development of proposals and/or other documents describing iCIMS’ products and services in response to requests from prospective clients and/or current clients when up for renewal.
  • Ensure all RFP/Proposal responses are submitted on time by demonstrating a sense of urgency and initiative while at times working on tight deadlines.
  • Establish the relationship and engage 3rd parties for support around technical / legal / and other questions.
  • Answer all proposal questions while keeping with the company standards and maintaining that competitive edge with the goal of convincing the requestor to buy our product(s).
  • Utilizes core messaging, product positioning content, and the answer bank to help creatively develop and write impelling answers to the questions being asking in the proposal.
  • Collaborates with other departments, especially Marketing, Sales, Legal, Technology, and other experts to produce high quality, accurate responses.
  • Monthly reporting via SalesForce on stats and RFP win/losses.
  • Maintains RFP database that includes the FAQ / Technical / Legal / Product answers.
  • Maintains all RFP supporting documents that includes standard operating procedure documentation, proposal templates, cover letters, acceptance criteria documentation.
  • Continuously kaizens and improves proposal responses and aligns proposal messaging with corporate goals.
  • Develops and maintains a technical understanding of the software so that technical details can be clearly and strategically communicated when required.
  • Becomes an expert with iCIMS’ suite of products, features, and benefits and develop a deep understanding of market and industry trends as well as users’ and prospects’ needs.
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity always and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies.
  • Receives and acts on feedback for continual professional improvement and development.
  • Takes measures to enhance body of knowledge and skill set through training.
6868.qualifications_html:
• Minimum 3 years of experience creating technical documentation and/or answering RFP/RFI documents
  • Experience working with Salesforce a plus
  • Excellent organization and project management skills
  • Solid writer, storyteller, editor and content strategist, who feels comfortable developing an idea into an impelling answer
  • Notable copy-writing skills that turn ideas into compelling stories
  • Copy-editing skills that take existing copy from good to great
  • Ideal candidates are bright, outgoing, self-motivated, enthusiastic, detail-oriented, have excellent and efficient writing skills, and can easily switch gears to manage multiple projects and deadlines
  • Keen eye for editing and ensuring content is complete, accurate.
  • Flexible and adaptable to a constant changing workload

Education 

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Journalism, Communications, Marketing, Business, English preferred or equivalent related work experience

6876.overview_html: Calling all account management professionals! Are you committed to providing a customer experience second to none? We’re seeking a proactive problem-solver who’s passionate about relationship building to join our team as an Account Manager, where you’ll be responsible for building best-in-class consultative relationships with clients within an assigned market segment. In this role, you’ll introduce and sell our products and services to existing users, as well as new divisions, subsidiaries and international counterparts within the company’s current footprint. You’ll work closely with our customers to fully understand their business strategies, expectations and needs, promoting renewals, expansions, and ensuring overall satisfaction. To succeed, you’ll need to be able to readily identify growth opportunities and potential risks to the partnership, as well as expertly navigate executive-level conversations. If you’re a tactful communicator with a caring touch, let’s talk!
6876.responsibilities_html:
Revenue: Builds partnerships through best in class full suite talent acquisition strategies.

  • Proactively solicits and drives new business within assigned accounts.
  • Creates and manages pipeline of revenue opportunities from within existing customer base of assigned segment.
  • Maintains accurate and timely customer, pipeline, and forecast data.
  • Asks thoughtful questions and displays effective listening.
  • Assesses customer needs and effectively links product value, features/benefits to those needs.
  • Works with internal resources to present and position company products and services to new divisions of existing clients.
  • Develops and maintains current product knowledge and can explain the business value of our offerings.
  • Prepares presentations, demonstrations, investment summaries, and sales contracts.
  • Creates, monitors and manages a sales pipeline to ensure consistent achieve of quotas and metrics.

 

Building Relationships: Delivers a customer experience second to none.

  • Earns and maintains position as a trusted advisor to client base through the development of exceptional relationships with key decision makers and internal stakeholders within assigned segment.
  • Conducts Executive Business Reviews to develop a deep understanding of the client’s needs and pain points with thoughtful, smart and creative dialogue. Links iCIMS’ products back to key business issues.
  • Proactively engages with clients to determine ongoing satisfaction, provide demonstrated value of iCIMS products and services and emphasizes the client’s return on investment.

Retention: Leverages adoption to build long term relationships.

  • Creates, monitors and manages a loss pipeline to ensure consistent achieve of quotas and metrics.
  • Proactively engages with customers to identify at-risk situations; escalating those instances to the appropriate resources within iCIMS who will execute those transactions.
  • Monitors adoption, engagement and usage of iCIMS talent acquisition platform relevant to each customer to identify risk to the partnership.
  • Manages business escalation issues as they relate ongoing customer retention. Routes all other escalation issues to the appropriate iCIMS’ support teams or other iCIMS’ resources.
  • Manages the contract renewal process inclusive of affirming and/or reestablishing the value of iCIMS software to all key client stakeholders and presenting our long-term vision as a technology partner.
  • Maintains accurate and current records of customer interactions and transactions, recording details of inquiries, complaints, and comments, as well as actions taken.

Compliance and due diligence

  • Proactively engages in professional development on an ongoing basis.
  • Takes steps to develop industry knowledge and influence customer Talent Acquisition operations by recommending industry best practices inside and outside of the iCIMS product suite.
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ core competencies, policies and procedures.
  • Uses Salesforce CRM to accurately track and record sales activity to ensure that metrics can be consistently measured.

• Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
  • A minimum of 5 years of account management or customer relationship management experience desirable, preferably in the HR services or Software-as-a-Service space or equivalent HR talent platform.
  • Basic understanding of fundamentals of Human Resources and employment process.
  • Displays capacity to negotiate deals with more than one point of contact inside customer organizations to satisfactory revenue requirements.
  • Passionate about problem solving, relationship building and creating customer loyalty.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Articulates thoughts and ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively, adjusting to differing audiences within a customer engagement.
  • Basic sales acumen and drive to participate in a sales environment with quota responsibilities
  • Exceptional time and project management skills. Ability to manage workload while understanding return on time investment.
  • Skilled at managing relationships with senior level executives within moderately complex organizations.
  • Able to communicate with and influence multiple layers within organizations, including Senior leadership.  Through a constant presence, becomes aware of changes in a customer's organization and adjusts approach accordingly.
  • Ability to clearly present material and effectively overcome objections.
  • High degree of comfort managing multiple, competing priorities in ambiguous environments.
  • Computer literate; proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook).  Must be able to quickly grasp new technology.
  • Experience with Salesforce or another Customer Relationship Management software preferred.
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth.
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative, who can proactively identify issues/opportunities, recommend actions and follow through to effective resolution.
  • Strong results orientation with a proven track record of flawless execution and strong attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated flexibility, resilience and creativity when solving for complex issues.
  • Ability to multi-task and handle multiple accounts and issues simultaneously.
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation. Ability to effectively create and sustain ongoing forums that encourage two-way communication opportunities.
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team environment.

6881.overview_html:
Are you an expert presenter who knows how to “talk technical”? Do you have extensive experience selling or demoing HR software? We’re looking for an outgoing, energetic self-starter with a strong customer-service orientation to join our team as a Product Specialist (Hiring), where you’ll collaborate with Sales, Labs and Product Marketing to enable and optimize revenue generation, influence product evolution and develop presentation messaging. In this role, you’ll work directly with our customers, Account Executives and Product Executives to understand customer needs related to screening, hiring and onboarding talent, and demonstrate how our products address our customers’ pain points. You’ll work with Product Marketing to generate presentation scripts and deliver product messaging and demonstration training to the rest of our Sales team, and influence product use case design through delivering consolidated customer feedback. If you’re a confident, first-rate communicator who’s passionate about sales enablement, this could be a perfect fit. 

 

The Product Specialist - Hiring serves as focal point between Sales, Labs, and Product Marketing to enable and optimize revenue generation, product evolution, and presentation messaging. The Product Specialist will work directly with customers, Account Executives, and Product Executives, to understand customer needs related to screening, hiring, and onboarding talent as well as provide solutions through product demonstration. The Product Specialist will influence product use case design and deliver consolidated feedback aimed at product improvement to the Labs organization. The PS will work with Product Marketing to generate presentation scripts and deliver product messaging and demonstration training to AE’s, PE’s, and Sales Engineers. A successful Product Specialist possesses the capability to demonstrate the value proposition and technical specifications of the Offer, Onboard, and relevant iCIMS products to prospective and current customers within all segments.  The Product Specialist will maintain and utilize the established process and practice to participate in product use case identification and design. This individual will influence the evolution of the product while working with Marketing to develop and update product messaging and demonstration scripts.  The Specialist develops and maintains expert level technical knowledge of iCIMS software, best practices and product capabilities.  Serving as a subject matter expert, the PS will work with the Sales teams to expand the iCIMS brand and deliver product training and enablement to the Sales department.
6881.responsibilities_html:
Essential Job Functions:

 

  • Supports Sales initiatives by providing accurate & dynamic demonstrations of Offer, Onboard, and Unifi along with the full suite of back of the funnel iCIMS products, for business development purposes (through webinars and in-person meetings).
  • Supports Labs development initiatives by providing rapid & consolidated feedback regarding the Offer, Onboard, Unifi and full suite of back of the funnel iCIMS products.
  • Acts as the internal and external Subject Matter Expert on all product-related questions.
  • Assists in uncovering and eliminating customer-specific business challenges relating to product functionality and delivery.
  • Works directly with and maintains contact with Account Executives & Product Executives to increase their knowledge and product demonstration skills.
  • Educates appropriate staff within our Sales Engineers for applicable product demonstration scripts
  • Understands competitive landscape and SWOT analysis for product line. Ensures demonstrations target product strengths matched to customer needs.
  • May present at webinars, events and tradeshows.
  • Thoroughly understands technical infrastructure and iCIMS architecture.
  • Creates technical documents and or questionnaires.
  • Consistently ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ core competencies.
  • Travels at least 40% of the time.

 

 

Additional Job Responsibilities:

 

  • Coordinates efforts with Sales, Account Management, Labs and technical service groups.
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and take initiative.
  • Maintains flexibility and react to change appropriately.
  • Receives and takes action on feedback and lessons learned for continual professional improvement and development.
  • Takes measures to enhance body of knowledge and skill set through training.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

 

  • Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
  • A minimum of 8 years of experience with product specialization, HR software or a related field preferred.
  • In depth understanding of Employee Offer/Onboarding Software & Related HRIS Industry Awareness
  • Previous experience working for a software or technology company is a plus.
  • Will be required to attain Demo Certification on applicable iCIMS Products.
  • Computer literate; proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Articulate thoughts and ideas clearly and persuasively. 
  • Ability to work effectively within a fast paced, changing environment that is going through high growth.
  • A self-starter with the demonstrated ability to take initiative, who can proactively identify issues/opportunities and recommend actions. 
  • Strong results orientation.
  • Able to work both independently and within a team environment.
  • Understanding of HR software space and particularly recruitment Hiring & Onboarding products is a plus.
  • Ability to look at the overall landscape and translate its pieces into actionable projects within a given solution environment.
  • Demonstrated flexibility, resilience and creativity when solving for complex issues.
  • Demonstrated customer service orientation.  Creates and sustains ongoing forums that encourage two-way communication opportunities.
  • Must be able to travel at least 40% of the time.

6882.overview_html: Do you have experience working in a 360-degree selling environment? Have you driven high-performing sales teams with documented success? We’re seeking a spirited, skilled communicator with software selling experience to join our team as a Manager, Prospect Sales – Mid-Market, where you’ll oversee a team of early career sales professionals and help them move opportunities through the pipeline. In this role, you’ll hire, train, motivate and mentor a team of Account Executives, coaching them through to close and setting them up for success. You’ll work to maximize sales performance in lead generation, opportunity creation, average deal size, close rates and sales cycle for our Majors (SMB) segment, tracking productivity, conducting performance analytics and performing CRM maintenance. If you’re competitive, collaborative and passionate about career coaching, we’re ready for you to come on board.
6882.responsibilities_html:
• Improve overarching sales metrics to include close rates, average deal size and time to close through ongoing training, coaching, and process improvement initiatives.
  • Drive consistent growth by enforcing and coaching to the proven iCIMS Sales Methodology
  • Grow our Majors client base by 30% year over year.
  • Manage a team of 6-7 sales reps to support our planned growth.
  • Manage individual and team quotas and provide Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Sales Metric analysis.
  • Improves close percentages of our Customer Sales team through ongoing training, coaching, and process improvement initiatives.
  • Establishes and maintains a merit-based, dynamic work environment that appeals to the top talent in the field and enables operational objectives.
  • Provides vision, planning & prioritization for team resources delegating and assigning projects, duties, and objectives.
  • Leads and coaches the team structuring appropriate training and development and eliminating roadblocks to team performance.
  • Establishes and maintains relevant controls and feedback systems to monitor the operation of the department.
  • Focuses on building and improving process efficiencies within team.
  • Responsible for management and attainment of individual/team quotas, and provides Monthly/Quarterly/Annual Sales Metric analysis.
  • Serves as an executive resource for on-site client presentations, technical inquiries, executive summaries, and contract negotiations.
  • Coordinates with Marketing to develop sales tools for use during the sales process.
  • Partners with Talent team on the acquisition and retention of people resources to fulfill team mission successfully. Owns the selection process.
  • Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS’ core competencies.

 

  

Additional Job Responsibilities:

 

  • Uses iCIMS’ Sales CRM to track and record sales activity to ensure that metrics can be accurately measured
  • Coordinates sales efforts with Marketing, Account Management, Inside Sales, Accounting, Legal, and technical service groups
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and takes initiative
  • Maintains flexibility and reacts to change appropriately
  • Receives and takes action on feedback for continual professional improvement and development
  • Takes measures to enhance body of knowledge and skill set through training
  • Other duties as assigned

• BS/BA degree desired; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • A Minimum 6 years of sales experience, preferably in the HR, Technology, Software-as-a-Service industry.

  • Exceptional sales forecasting and reporting analytics.
  • Team goal focused.
  • Ability to motivate and challenge a seasoned and growing sales team.
  • Ability to multi-task and handle multiple clients and issues simultaneously.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills with a high degree of approachability and the ability to work seamlessly in a team oriented environment.

  • Travel: 10-20%.
