6925.overview_html: Have you negotiated a high volume of complex contracts? Are you used to working with client-facing teams? We’re looking for a creative problem-solver who’s cool under pressure to join our team as a Counsel - Contracting, Technology, where you’ll provide commercial contracting support and legal counsel for various business teams throughout the organization. In this role, you’ll be working with name brand, global vendors and clients to help us negotiate complex, SaaS agreements and other contracts. You’ll negotiate issues relating to data privacy and security matters, provide legal and contract support for our extensive vendor marketplace, and help us negotiate strategic partnerships. To succeed, you’ll need to be able to expertly identify nuanced legal issues with an eye to our business needs, and devise ways for the business to forge ahead when faced with potential roadblocks. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a fast-growing, evolving technology company and help drive exciting new initiatives. If you’re an organized, self-starter who lives for closing a deal, let’s chat!
6925.responsibilities_html:
The role will focus on the following key areas:
• Negotiate global, complex customer and vendor contracts, including, subscription, software licensing and services arrangements, as well as, partner and alliance agreements.
• Act as an advisor to internal customers on a variety of legal matters.
• Help enable the business to execute on commercial changes by understanding and providing guidance on relevant legal and compliance issues.
• Aid in the adoption and execution of controls necessary to ensure compliance as an employer and third-party service provider, including drafting, reviewing, updating, and enforcing internal policies and procedures.
• Drive intellectual property protection and enforcement, including copyrights, trade secrets, and patents, as applicable, as necessary.
• Partner to manage vendor relationships and assist with building effective partnerships, while helping to lower costs and secure agreements.
• Assist with litigation matters, as necessary.
• Conduct research on a variety of legal issues and act as an expert on some key areas

• Help address global employment matters in collaboration with Talent/Human Resources, including country-specific employment arrangements, proprietary rights protection, non-compete arrangements, immigration matters, employee grievances, and employment terminations.
• Consistently ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies
6925.qualifications_html:
A minimum of 3 years of experience negotiating complex software as a service, software licensing, professional services, and/or other technology transactions is required. 4+ years of related experience is preferred. 

• Strong drafting skills.
• Knowledge of federal, state and local laws.
• Ability to work independently, while being a collaborative member of the team
• Ability to analyze case law and provide recommendations.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
• Strong customer orientation focus and success in creating a superior Customer Experience.
• Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with the Management and Executive Team, and company employees.
• Demonstrated success in displaying passion, drive, adaptability and innovation.
• Ability to organize and manage multiple, and at times competing priorities.
• Demonstrated ability to solve practical problems or resolve issues in a timely manner.
• Proficient in the MS Office Suite
• Ability to thrive in a fast paced, growing organization.
• Strong track record of success in building solid working relationships within various areas/business functions of the company.

 

Education/Certifications/Licenses Required

• Bachelor's Degree and Juris Doctor from an accredited law school.
• Membership in the State Bar as an attorney qualified to practice law in the State of NJ, or eligible to become licensed as in-house counsel.

6936.overview_html:
The Research Director, Technology will define and execute a research strategy for the technology space to develop and communicate persona-relevant insights for the organization, with the goal of providing insights that inform and engage key executives.  The research should showcase timely market perspectives as well as the knowledge and expertise retained within iCIMS, inclusive of insights from the company’s proprietary system data.

 

The Research Director will work cross-functionally with teams of resources in Marketing, Sales and Labs to deliver against the annual strategic plan which will include the deployment of thought leadership materials and spokespeople in brand activities (public relations, analyst relations, events, social media, etc.) as well as within prescribed, one-to-one engagements with select prospects and customers.

 

The Research Director will execute a robust communications strategy with the aim of driving thematic content across the trends in IT.  This position reports into the Sr. Director of Brand.
6936.responsibilities_html:
• Develop research calendar in support of the company’s overall integrated communications plan and broader corporate objectives.
  • Devise and manage research projects including methodology recommendations, day-to-day project management, data analysis and strategic recommendations.
  • Collaborate well with research team members.
  • Analyze and communicate research plan and outcomes/insights both internally and externally.
  • Evaluate creative executions for accurate interpretation of research strategic insights.
  • Work under defined deadlines and budgets.
  • Support persona development journey mapping for the IT space.
  • Play a key role brainstorming and advising on how the various buyer persona audience members can be targeted with content that appeals specifically to each.
  • Write high quality, clear, actionable, advisory research documents.
  • Remain ahead of the curve on developments and issues within these specified areas as well as applicable adjacent areas.
  • Proactively work with the wider sales organization and deliver outstanding sales support in order to retain and grow the business.
  • Drive the creation of content focused on key sustainable themes to target audiences.
  • Identify and integrates established thought leadership content creators/spokespeople into the thought leadership practices.
  • Create a platform that promotes customer engagement and interaction, allowing iCIMS to demonstrate the value and relevance of our insight and analysis.
  • Manage staff thought leadership efforts, in the creation of high quality, timely and high-impact outputs. 
  • Help to ensure that all content is on brand, and of the highest editorial quality.
  • Collaborate with writers and designers to help define a compelling vision for iCIMS storytelling and how our ideas can be best presented in the market.
  • Adapt implications and actions by situation, strategic business context.
  • Extend personal experience to an array of clients and situations.
  • Represent iCIMS as the subject matter expert and executive spokesperson for research materials created in a variety of settings (one to many, one to few)
  • Communicate complex concepts concisely and with authority.
  • Create a metrics-driven environment for measuring the success of content as it relates to driving traffic, engagement and sales.
  • Ensures that business is conducted with integrity and that behavior aligns with iCIMS policies, procedures, and core competencies.

6941.overview_html: Calling all charismatic communicators! Do you have your sights set on a career in sales? We’re looking for a polished, highly-motivated extrovert to join our sales team as an Inside Sales Representative. In this role, you’ll work closely with our Account Executives to effectively convert marketing generated leads to potential iCIMS customers within our Majors segment, responding to active and passive inquiries about our products and services, and scheduling product demonstrations.  We’re seeking someone with a high level of professionalism and business acumen—someone who can successfully articulate our value proposition in a sophisticated manner. 6950.overview_html: Calling all sales trainers!  Do you share our passion for professional development? We’re seeking an expert collaborator and true training maestro to join our Talent Development team as a Sales Trainer. You’ll be responsible for the development and delivery of a curriculum focused on product, process, selling methodology, and soft skills necessary to drive professional development, sales growth, and revenue attainment. In this role, you’ll be asked to leverage your experience training sellers on software-as-a-service (SaaS) products to construct scalable and repeatable on-boarding programs for new employees, as well as ongoing training for continued professional development. You’ll develop robust resources for individuals (and teams) looking to enhance particular skill sets, working with key stakeholders to build out project plans and develop learning materials. Through the programs you design (and lead!), you’ll help keep our sellers savvy, and have an opportunity to directly impact the team’s success. If you’re a team player who’s passionate about teaching skills to drive results, this could be a perfect fit!

  • Determine training requirements by studying sales and marketing strategic plans and current sales results; conferring with sales leaders on training strategies; evaluating training effectiveness to support in driving results

  • Act as point of contact and liaison between Talent Development department for Sales and Marketing leadership department

  • Design and create engaging learning activities and compelling course content
  • Partner with subject matter experts in the business to prepare for upcoming product releases and enhancements to design, create and deliver appropriate training programs for sales employees
  • Set instructional design objectives and create aligned content
  • Create supporting material/media (audio, video, simulations, role plays, games etc) to reinforce and sustain learnings
  • Applying tested instructional design theories, practice and methods to creating and building new content
  • Deliver, and continuously improve the iCIMS Sales Methodology Training Program as well as on-going learning opportunities for the company’s sales professionals by providing training on our sales process, sales systems (SFDC) and value proposition in a blended learning model
  • Utilize a variety of the training methodologies, modalities, techniques, concepts, learning tools, and practices to ensure maximum effectiveness of trainings offered to our sales teams
  • Conduct segment specific Sales training needs assessments to support the design, development and delivery of improvements to the iCIMS Sales training program
  • Shorten external ramp-up time, while also facilitating internal growth in an organization where we promote rapidly. Create and revise learning assessments for measuring comprehension to monitor the learning and development impact to the business
  • Decide on the criteria used to assess learners performance and develop assessment instruments
  • Incorporate feedback from class participants and other training stakeholders to improve and expand curriculum and teaching methodology
  • Analyze program feedback and deliver metrics to management
  • Maintain training records, statistics, monthly metrics, project documentation and course folders
  • Assist Training Coordinator where needed with data entry
  • Ensure all training rooms, equipment and other requirements are reserved and/or cancelled based on training need

6953.overview_html: Calling all product managers! 6958.overview_html: Is your background in benefits or compensation? Do you possess any experience with using HR systems? If so, then you may be the detail-oriented, expert collaborator who we need to join our team as a total rewards analyst I! More specifically, you will use your spreadsheet skills to evaluate jobs and make salary recommendations, and design and administer incentive plans. In addition, you will use your people skills to partner with our talent-development and corporate-communication teams to educate employees on our benefits and compensation packages. If you’re looking for exposure to senior leadership, the opportunity to learn new skills and the chance to join a growing team, then apply now!
